reviews.review: Nature wins. When visiting Ta Phrom first time i was really impressed how the nature is overcoming the human built constructures. It is a MUST to visit
Think "Raiders of the Lost Ark". Unlike anything you've ever seen. 300 year old trees that have overtaken the temple. Spectacular inside and out. Truly a wonder of the world.
Very lmpresive. A huge temple that was built on the 12 century,a very spectacular and important archaeological site.you can really feel the history

A Reminder To Us All. My personal favorite of all the temples. It's a reminder to us all that regardless of how formidable we may be today, in the end Mother Nature will reclaim what's rightfully hers. A brilliant decision on the part of École française d'Extrême-Orient to preserve, but not restore. If you have but a day to temple gaze this would be one of the two I would choose. The other of course, Angkor Wat.

Mesmerising !. Ta Prohm is located North East of Angkor wat Temple. considered part of the Small tour Temples, this temple comes after visiting Banteay Kdei temple. Primarily worshipped for Lord Shiva, then when kingdom adopted Buddishm, idols of buddha can be seen.What to expect from this temple ?1. Huge Trees that are surreal, unlike anything you will ever see in your life. Specially the tree on the roof top of temple from East Gate takes your imagination to next level2. very good sculptures intact at some areas of temple, while most are broken & that eerie silence follows you always3. if you are in a group, you will probably not enjoy that feel other than people talking loud, photo moments etc, where you will not share that special bond place is trying to convey to you. Trust me, its not ruined monument you are paying a visit, these have withstood times more than we can ever live for & a testimony to dedication of these people to their god & their king, simply an excellance that has tested maths, science, astronomy etc., awe inspiring engineering feat ...4. exit by west gate, where your tuk tuk, taxi will await you,cheers

The temple of doom!. Indiana Jones is greating- absoultely fascinating scenery with temples overgrown by trees with gigantic roots. The whole thing looks like a film set from a movie and indeed it was used for that- Lara Croft: Tomb Raider
Taphrom. The number 1 temple is Siem Reap but very crowded with many people and mostly Chinese but the best one to see.
Amazing Root. Our mind is different after we step in this beautiful temple. It has the greatest area that the huge tree growing on the temple.
Unbelievably beautiful. It is worth seeing because of the way the tree roots intertwine with the ancient building. You must see it for yourself because the pictures don't do it justice.

Just Wow. This is my second visit to Ta Prohm and it is amazing and mesmerizing even this is my second visit .... the only down part is that certain area are closed for "renovation" ... other then that it is still amazing to visit ..... do put this place in you list too.....
Overgrown and beautiful. I was most anxious to see this temple and it definitely lives up the hype. Try to come early or late to avoid the crowds and its guaranteed you'll get stunning photographs.
temple not to be miss!. Wonderful views with trees on top of temple it is one of the best you should miss out. it was build by the king Jaya varamsn VII.

Stunning view! . This is the temple featured in the movie Tomb Raider I believe. Aside from that fun fact, this was a beautiful temple with huge trees intertwined with everything inside. Some of the trees were so bring and shining, it looks almost glossy to me. It's probably one of my favorite temples I've seen on my trip.

Nature at its best. Amazing and beautiful describes Ta Prohm perfectly. A peaceful place with nature taking it back. The Tome Raider movies made it famous but if you're lucky enough to visit you will fall in love. A photographers paradise.
My favorite place in Angkor Wat. This place was simply breathtaking and amazing. Reminded me of the ghibli film "Castle In the Sky"(Laputa).
Lara Croft!!!. Great for those who appreciate great architecture. Immerse yourself in history as you walk through the stone structure.

Spectacular trees. Not only was this temple a spectacular structure, the way the trees have grown around it is spectacular. A guard/guide that worked in the temple came to offer us some help to take photos and then followed us around the whole time. Even though he had lots of stories and knowledge of the area we knew we were getting hassled and he followed us all the way out until we gave him a tip. Left a bit a disappointing taste in our mouth of the overall temple experience.

Incredible and surreal.. This place was high on my bucket list not because of the movie but the history. It did not let me down - give yourself a good three hours or more here.We went later afternoon as the crowds were a lot lower then.
Wow. We went twice. It is so amazing to see this place in person. If you can go when it rains or right after it's such a difference as all the moss turns bright green and comes to life.
Nature is amazing. The most beautiful, breath-taking place I have been in Seam Reap. Unbelievable wonder of Nature. One needs to see it by all means.
Another great place. This was my favourite. This is simply amazing. Became famous for the Tomb Raider movies but is so special. Make sure this is on your list.

Lara Croft. MUST be worth a visit
Amazing trees taken over the temple. Wear comfortable shoes as there are a lot of steps and uneven flooring. I did this with my 75 year old husband who managed it well.

Breathtaking scene of Nature vs. Mankind. Standing among the ancient architecture entwined with the sky-reaching old trees, one simple could not help to feel belittled by the force of nature and the humbleness of mankind. Man try so hard to leave their mark on the face of the Earth while the Nature is set to erase them over time. Visit this not only for the photography capacity but also for the philosophy!
Very beautiful temple.. This a temple we liked than other temples we saw in siem reap... specailly we want see a spot of movie from American...Now we saw it.
Jungle temple. This temple was one of our favorites as you really feel like Indian Jones or Tomb Raider walking through the ruins alongside the huge overgrown trees. The highlight of the whole area.

Unforgettable!. Remember to take sunglasses, water, and an umbrella!This way is gorgeous; of course the trees growing within were the best part for me. Absolutely amazing and definitely worth the entrance fees.

Nature conquers all man made empires eventually. Part of my day trip. I'm templed out, but this one was my favourite on the day. Quiet setting. Photo genic. One of the Policemen! or guards/officials offered to take a few snaps of me, how kind I thought, as a solo traveller I have plenty shots without my mug in it. "Now you give me money" he rather sheepishly asked afterwards.Tomb Raider was set here apparently. Indiana Jones stuff, yeah I can see that.

Very beautiful temple in the jungle. This is truly amazing. You get a good sense of just how quickly the jungle takes over and it helps to understand how amazing it must have been when the temple complex was "rediscovered" in the jungle.

Must see. Must see atraction. Tray to wake up early and go there before ather tourists go. This is only the way to take pictures without crowds of people on it. Also the weather in the morning is not as hot.Recommended.
Ta Prohm!!. Aaaah Ta Prohm! My favourite temple of all!! Lovely walk around with plenty shade and amazing trees still surviving on the temples! Incredible
2nd visited. Since visited this temple 3 years ago, nothing much changed. Temple now crowd with tourist compare to before, although we already using reverse small circle route.
Beautiful and worth the trip. The forest taking over the ruins is incredible - make sure you take a guide to show you the unexpected

The classic Tomb Raider site. Certainly one of the top 3 that you need to do when visiting Angkor Wat. Its a drive from the main site and you tourguide is the best person to get you there. The fact that the trees are taking back the temple in such a way makes for terrific photography. Go in the morning or afternoon for the best shots as the midday sun can play havoc with skyward images

Great place - only drawback: You are not alone ;-). Hi allone of the most interesting temples (yes, but this one is a bit different)the temple is more or less overgrown by the jungle, this creates a nice athmosphere.dont missschlampi

My favourite temple. This is a must see - I would even suggest the tuk tuk driver to take you early on as it gets super busy and there are so many cool photo opportunities that you don't want to miss! Place where they filmed parts of Tomb Raider and it really feels like ancient ruins. I loved it!

Nature takes over. Ta Prohm is made famous by the movie Tomb Raider but I don't get to see any Angelina Jolie wannabe prancing around during my visit. Instead I am being mesmerize by the power of nature that regained what was once cleared for the building of man made monumental structures. The trees, roots and vines grew over the years and wrapped themselves around Ta Phrom structures giving and eerie feeling that nature can and will fight back.
Spectacular. The trees growing through this temple were fascinating. It really added to the theory that this was a lost temple for hundreds of years.

Things to know. Price increase in February 2017Prices almost double3 day from $20 to $37Park pass include access to all sites and are for 24 hour periodSo sunrise leave return firs user same day coveredUse of multiple day passes allowed for a week not consecutive days

Amazing... Nature meets ancient history. I recommend visiting Ta Prohm. It's a unique case where you see old historic buildings being overtaken by nature. The temples are also very beautiful. They remind me of the Mayan ruins in some ways...
Also known in the movies as the "Temple of Doom". Great temple. Well worth the visit! Much bigger than expected and the old trees within and now part of the temple are awesome!

Your last stop of temple tour. If you are still energetic, please visit this temple and make that your last stop after your lunch which will need at least 02 hour to fully enjoy the next temple scenery with your One day temple tour ticket (of USD20/person)
Amazing Temple. One of the' Have To' temples to see, absolutely awesome. Heaps of great photo opportunities. A medium fitness level would be an advantage.

Must see attraction. This is one of the most coolest (temperature wise) very shaded. Not a hard walk, no climbing. 1 hour and and your done
I call it a click and tick visit
Must see,take a pic, tick it off the list
Must see.. This place is worth visiting just for the trees. Such a beautiful harmony between ancient stone temple and mother nature. You could spend lots of time here. Magical.

Wow...!. Our professional guide ( use the government sanctioned guides, get your hotel to organise as the 'guides' at the temples are not professionals)....Oney, was amazing.....extremely knowledgable, great English.

Very atmospheric. You can see trees taking over in some other temples but not to the extent as here. Some of the trees and roots are enormous. Stunning. The site does get a lot of visitors and you have to wait your turn for photos. Sometimes difficult to get a shot or view of the trees/roots by themselves.
Very interesting and beautiful temple. We loved wandering around this temple where the trees are growing in the buildings. It is beautiful and well worth a visit while in Siem Reap.

"Remarkable and Astonishing !". Ta Prohm is highly un-explainable sight with all those big trees that comes in forms and sizes. The site is truly amazing. I enjoyed every bit of its place and sight & made it even wonder how Gods created this place. A must see when you are in Siem Reap.

More interesting of the lot..... Located to the west of the complex...this is more interesting as we can see how the Trees and forests have taken over the temple.
There are a lot of nooks and cranies to take good photos of.

Otherworldly. Ta Phrom has mostly been left as it was re-discovered, with nature slowly winning it's battle with man, the jungle reclaiming the temple with monumental trees dominating Khmer masonry.This is a flatter temple than most in the area, formerly a Mahayana Buddhist Monestry or University. You can now only enter the temple from it's East or West gates and there's a recommended or largely pre-determined way in which you can venture thru' it's moats and alleys. There's a few obvious photograph opportunities which can cause queues so patience in the heat is required.The trees resemble melted candles that have infiltrated the stonework, with neither the temple or the trees themselves able to support themselves without one another. Beautiful and intriguing in equal amounts.Although this is a flat temple you still require sturdy trainers or boots as the temple's had little renovative work and many of the fallen stones and facades remain strewn within it's moats.

So this is where directors of movies get their ideas from. Wow. All of Ankor unbelievable but seeing the tree growth through, over and around the structures is just amazing. Do not do late in day after other sites as you don't want to be dead tired when seeing this one.

Otherworldly. Don't go because of the silly Tomb Raider movie, go because this is an astonishing piece of human history, overtaken by the jungle before it's "discovery" in the modern era. Take your time to find a quiet moment when the tour groups have rushed past.

The jungle and temples compete. This was the highlight of my temple touring. The way that nature is pushing herself against the manmade structures is both beautiful and awe-inspiring. Go and see and listen to Mother-Nature all around you.
THE TREES!. the trees growing in and around the buildings was amazing, my second favourite temple to Angkor Watt, very different to the other temples, definitely enjoyed this visit!

Not a computer game. The temple complex is the location for some of the action in a computer game and subsequent movie. Eerie and amazing. Preserving the sinuous to preserve the buildings. Take good shoes.

My best visit in Siem Reap. Other people may prefer Ankor Wat, yet for myself I like this place most. Ankor Wat evidences the mighty power of the Khmer kingdom, this place shows the beauty of the combination of human's effort and nature.
I won't regret for a second visit.

Nature meets history. Don't be put off by this one being the "touristy" tomb raider temple. It's truly amazing!!! The power of nature and the incredible human history meets and makes this a stunning, photographic, amazing place to visit!
Best. Ta prohm is best temple for visiting .The temple very very interesting with the tree on the top temple .

Make it your own adventure! . Go here with an open mind, an open heart, and some knowledge of the area. You will not be disappointed. You do not have to follow the crowd, the signs, or the norms. Find what you like, walk all the way around things, meet the monks and nuns, gather blessings, hug the trees, avoid the monkeys.It is all as beautiful as you want it to be. Do not let the selfie sticks and rudeness of others detract form your experience of this stunning location.

Our favorite temple. This is a magical place, shady from the trees growing out of the temple and birds are chirping in the morning. We went twice, once with a guide to get all the details and the second time alone so we could wander at will.

Lots of people but an okay place to visit. Many people know this as the Tomb Raider site, hence the popularity. However it was only an average experience for me. There is nothing here to capture my interest other than the sites in the movie pointed out by the guide.

Ta Prohm or the Tomb Raider fantasy. When thinking about Ta Prohm, an image of a temple swallowed in a jungle appears in mind.The reality is does not lead to the expectation: in order to preserve the temple, most of the trees have been removed, which resulted in a site well manicured.The history and the culture around the temple have faded, and looks more like an attraction rather than a historical site.It is still worth going if you have the time for a short visit.

Probably the best temple in the park. . Have been wanting to explore this temple for as long as the travel bug has been with me. Have to say that I wasn't disappointed from the moment we walked through the gate. What a great 3 hours we had walking around this great temple that nature has taken over. There are so many great spots to grab some great photo's, and the local security that are dotted around the temple. An absolute must do when you're in the Angkor park for the day.

Amazing!. This is a fantastic temple! The 600 year old trees growth out of the ancient temple is amazing! So many great photo opportunities! Try to get here earlier in the day as there are not as many people. Try to get away from the masses, there are lots of smaller areas that give great views and you can generally be alone for a few minutes in peace and quiet. One of the best temples in the area!

Beautiful piece of history. One of my favorite temples in Siem Reap and would rate it above Angkor Wat! The tree that grows down the entire side of the temple is quite a site. I recommend getting one of the guides that can tell you more about it - I found them all very knowledgable and heard them speaking quite a lot of languages.
One of the most beautiful temples in Angkor Wat!. This is the temple not to miss! The massive tree roots strangling the remains of this temple are marvelous and eerie. A beautiful place.
Cool!!. It's my first time to see ancient trees growing up on temples inside a jungle. Also one of the must visit temples in Siem Reap.

Hands down, the best temple. Couldn't get enough of this temple. The only way it could have been better would have been to have it to myself from sunrise to sundown, but settling for 2 1/2 hours has got me thinking of another visit.
Temple Visit. You must see these historic temples in this area. It gives and insight into culture and history of the Cambodian people.Cover up. Not exposed shoulders or knees
Loved it. This was a temple I had been waiting to see for years and it did not disappoint. Spectacular trees and it's absolutely breathtaking taking and impressive. Absolutely a must see

My favourite temple!. I almost skipped Ta Phrom since I had one day in Siem Reap and wanted to do 2 temples. Took a friend's advice and went to Preah Khan instead... by the time I was done with Bayon, my Tuk-Tuk driver convinced me to go to Ta Phrom, and it was worth the extra de-tour time and money. LOVED IT!It's gorgeous for photos - I was super lucky to go on a cloudy and slightly damp day, so the grass and trees looked extra green. Also, the rocks, ruins and the trees make for great photos.

Magical Temple with Nature as its Ruler!. Ta Prohm is definitely worth going if you only have one day in Angkor. The temple is covered with tree branches, big roots and plants everywhere creating an unique Charme. I especially liked it because of the individual ways you can go to explore it. I gave only 4 out of 5 rating points because of the very touristic atmosphere almost everywhere around the temple complex. Still definitely worth checking out!
Truly wonderful!. This was an awesome experience learning the history was amazing. The architect was fantastic and so was our guide :-)

Impressive views and worldknown thanks to Tomb Raider. Smaller than Angkor Wat but anyhow impressive to see massive trees growing on top of the half-collapsed temple ruins.Definitely worth a stop when you do the small temple tour.

I loved the nature within this temple!. The trees growing on and through this temple are well known. Part of this temple is big blocks of stone which can't be accessed. As it was raining season the nature was stunning. We loved this temple!
Massive amazing trees. This is the site where Tomb Raider movie was filmed . The trees that wrap round the temple is so stunning and breathe taking .

Unbelievable Creation of Mother Nature. At Ta Prohm, after the entrance there will be a ticket checkpoint. Thereafter, walked about 250 metres under good shades before arriving at the temple. At the temple, saw many huge trees with gigantic roots gripping, curling on the ruins of the temple. Never think, never imagine, never seen such strange occurrence where roots can held so firmly to a temple. That's the strange element of mother nature. So magical. Simply unbelievable.
Tomb raider temple !. Very mysterious temple and the force of nature just destroy the human civilization. Please try the echo chamber.

Another Wonder. As we were told numerous time this is where they filmed the Tomb Raider movie. Unbelievable trees that have been intertwined with the buildings it is good that they rea trying to stabilised this site. Quite impressive
Loved this magical temple. Do it! See it! It's magical. Make sure you have a guide that has a car to transport you. Wear sunscreen.

Quickly deteriorating. Visiting this place for the 7th time. I always enjoy the beautiful trees and temple but now there is hardly anthing of the temple that looks like the very first time I saw it. I wonder how it could ever be restored. Still the walk to and from and around is enjoyable.

Uncomparable beauty. The trees were enormously high stretching so far into the sky with roots that were the gigantic and growing over the stone temples and into every crevice. Every corner we turned was magical. So glad we came here. My personal favourite of all the amazing temples

Holiday . Booked a short break with my girlfriend and mate , flew in from Koi Samui , just a fantastic piece of history , grabbed a tuk tuk for a couple of days and went round most of the temples , just brilliant . If you gonna do it do it in a tuk tuk , great way to see what's going on
Wonders. It is to see how trees have grown on stone in the temple. It is difficult to imagine and beliefs that roots of the trees could sustain so strongly on the stone.One shouldn't miss it.

Superb. We recently visited the Ta Prohm site with a group of friends. The site itself is magnificent. The power of nature is truly on display here. It was very hot and there are steps everywhere. Exhausting but well worth the visit and pain.

AKA Tomb Raider. We loved it here! It truly is more beautiful and fascinating to see it up close and personal and the pictures you see in books don't do it justice. Many opportunities to take photos and to just wander around. We visited during rainy season and the trees were green and lush. As I said in all my temple reviews- wear mosquito repellent and bring water and a fully charged camera.

Favorite Temple in Siem Reap. By far my favorite temple - even more so than Angkor Wat! First of all no stairs which makes it easier to get around especially on hot days. The green moss that hugs all the temples is beautiful and you really get that Indiana Jones feel. The large trees that strangle the ancients ruins are a site to be seen! beautiful!!

While in Cambodia.... While in Cambodia, you'd be doing yourself a disservice by not visiting Angkor - and various temples within the greater Archaeological Park. Much like the Great Pyramids of Egypt, Angkor provides a look in to the ancient history of the region - and one cannot help but marvel at the engineering feats before them and contemplate the greater significance of the sites.Ta Prohm, specifically made famous thanks to the Tomb Raider movie, is an impressive site. Significantly flatter than many of the other temples in the area, it is a bit easier to navigate around without wearing yourself out. Definitely a great temple worth visiting while in the archaeological park.

My favourite temple!. Angkor Wat is amazing due to it sheer size alone, but I love this temple for its serenity and the way it has quietly entwined itself with nature. Take a guide who will help you avoid the groups and explain the history and meanings of the carvings. Some extraordinary photo opportunities here, as are some intricate apsara carvings.

Breathtaking. A must see if you're travelling to Siem Reap, absolutely excellent! Even though it started raining it still looked stunning, try to go, however, on a hot sunny day having driven past it on a sunnier day it looked truly something else!
Incredible Trees. The afternoon visit to Ta Prohm was a great tour. We saw the temples and big trees. Had taken a lot of photos since the weather was very good.

Tree temple. Amazing temple, my favorite amongst all I saw in Siem Reap.
The scenes of the trees taking over the temple, as if nature claims its space back, is awesome!
Sightseeing. Like the other temples this is just as awesome. When in Cambodia, don't forget to come to this temple.

Amazing Temple. To me.. this place hasn't been change for hundred of year.. everything seem ancient... great to see and love the architecture and the sculpture and the surrounding environment so grren.

Amazing Overgrown Temple. If it wasn't for all the tourists you could really feel like Indiana Jones for a few hours. Take your time, explore the areas away from the crowds and enjoy the overrun temple

Famous temple. This is the famous temple of "Angelina Jolie".
It is just amzing to see the trees growing on the temples.
For me it is also great to see that the people try to support the temples not to collaps! Even it this is not looking nice on pictures.

Wow.. These ruins are fascinating. Make it the last stop of your day out at Angkor Wat. It is shaded and much cooler than other areas of the ruins. Beware of the loads of vendors harassing you at the entrance.

Photographers, this is the place!. Although the temple is mostly in ruins, they have built walkways so you can get amazing photos of the jungle reclaiming the buildings. The incredible trees frame the temple and are in some cases, holding the temple together. This site should definitely be on your top ten list for Siem Reap.

No two the same. I am so very glad i was able to hire Angkor Visitor (Praim hear) for my personal guide. I would have missed most of the fascinating details of this intricate world heritage site. Very worth seeig and ecperiencing.
Just amazing. We loved every moment in Siemreap to explore Angkor Wat complex. Ta Prohm was the heart stopping beauty for us

Great Temple. This was our first stop of our Tour and it was great. Our guide told us the whole history of that place and it was amazing. It's impressive how the trees grew on the buildings...and roots grew everywhere and anywhere on the buildings. Recommended to go visit this place!
Absolutely stunning!. This was my favorite temple out of all of them! So beautiful that it looks like it should be from a story book. MUST VISIT!
Truly Amazing. A must visit if you are in Cambodia. Remarkable and very affordable to visit. Highly recommended place to visit.

Spooky and Outstanding. This Cambodian relic draws you into a mystical past. Also where the film Tomb Raider was filmed. It needs some TLC as a lot of it is crumbling. I hope the government is able to afford to upkeep this unbelievable place.

Beautiful do this one last. A beautiful temple - we did this one as our last temple it is shady a lot cooler and stunning colours - it just finishes of a fabulous trip and you will get some great photos here. Love it

Awesome Nature vs History. It finally rained when we arrived here, however, it was welcome relief from the weather we dealt with at Angkor Wat and Bayon. Whether it rains or not, this place was awesome. The jungle has attempted to reclaim this place and it makes the place magical. The temple is not in great shape, you come across many piles of crumbed building, however, it is clear that this is a special place. There are several trees coming out of buildings, trees encasing walls and two tree which seem to have no grounding at all, they are the temples reaching for the heavens. I have not seen Tomb Raider, calling it Tomb Raider, as our guide did, does nothing to assist the appeal of this place, you will feel it when you arrive.

Wow. Terrific temple still overrun by the forest in some areas. Beautifully restored and very enjoyable site. Loved the ancient trees intertwined with the temple walls and columns. Superb surreal ambience.
Tree on the building. Amazing that surrounding area growth with all tall tree more than thousand year. Must visit where can't get this hot spot in others country easier.

Early morning visit. Ta Prohm is atmospheric and wonderful.The trees are close and still in/on the temple. Lots of rubble and fallen walls around the place. Very green and lush around - thee during the monsoon.

Great but crowded. The temple is amazing, however the overwhelming number of people detracted from it slightly. I realise that it is a popular destination, and there are always going to be crowds, however a bit of common courtesy goes a long way. Everyone wants photos, but it doesn't take much to be respectful of people wanting to get photos that are empty of people.I will say a big thank you to the tour guide who prevented his group from walking through our photos. They only had to wait five seconds for us to get the shot we wanted.Definitely worth the hype, but try to time it without the crowds (if that is at all possible).

Move out my way I want to take a picture. Fantastic architecture and tree growth . Unfortunately so popular that it would be better to arrive early in the morning so that you get a chance to see without too many other tourist and being pushed out the way so they can take pictures

The best temple in Angkor!. This was my 4th visit to Ta Prohm in 8 years, and I genuinely never tire of it. It's a spectacular place to explore, and if you get there early you can almost get the place to yourself, and feel like you're discovering it for the first time. Truly magical experience and a must-see on any itinerary of Angkor!

A Different kind of feeling.. This was my favourite temple. Less people and thus much quieter. The trees growing through the walls and foundations give a really eerie feeling. I believe it was used in the production of the movie Tomb Raider.

Perhaps the best of the lot. Atmospheric, shady and cool and jam packed with the pics you came all this way to take. A lot of it is undergoing restoration so parts of it are inaccessible but don't let that put you off. It can get packed so head in the opposite direction from the tour groups and you'll find some beautifully peaceful corners to explore. An unforgettable temple that should be on everyone's itinerary.

Small but mighty. This was one of the smallest temples we visited but was our favorite. The way it which the trees have grown through were very interesting. We toured it about midday but was still cooler than the others as there was much more shade. We searched and found the carving of the stegoceras which was very interesting. A must visit if you are looking at the large range of temples here
Mr. good It was veryday to visit thus place with Mr Porin he was very nice guy I recommend my friends to come here.
Tomb Raider. This is where a lot of tomb raider was shot, I can understand why Angelina Jolie fell in love with this country the people and sights are just outstanding

One of the best temples in the complex. After visiting other temples at siem reip this temple was the most damaged but was great place to visit. Great location fab architecture and loads of photo opportunities. The trees with in the complex entwined within the temples are fab although don't look real!!! Well worth a visit.
A unique temple. This temple is still being renovated. It is built around ancient trees which are very much a part of the architecture. What a different experience.
Ta Prohm, Banyan, and Angkor Wat - all you need to see.. Ta Prohm, Banyan, and Angkor Wat - all you need to see. These were the highlights by far, and we'd say they were all equally amazing!
Great atmosphere. This place was awesome. We visited between 12-1pm while all the bus groups were at lunch. the atmosphere was fantastic.

Jungle temple . We came here as part of a bigger day tour temple hopping in siem reap . This place is actually jaw dropping ! Unreal to see how the jungle took over and now how the massive trees are supporting the ruins . The roots of these trees have to be seen to be believed ! You'll spend at least an hour here , some great pics to be gotten . The place is very busy , be prepared for lots of other visitors . Bring lots of water !

It's the tomb raider temple, and also the best one!. This was the last temple our guide took us to, at about 330pm when the crowds had died down a bit and the sunshine was beaming through the canopy creating the most amazing colours. The trees are amazing all twisted in the temple. Nature fighting back at its best and really is a must see when in siem reap. You will never be disappointed!

Amazing and beautiful tomb raider temple. On the temple trail, you will be brought to this temple after angkor wat and it will not disappoint. Nature has taken over and the trees literally grow around these ancient temples. A must see.
Jungle temple . This temple is very different with trees still growing and holding temple together. Must see. Very different from others.

Favourite of the temples. Can't rave about this place enough. Just amazing to see the trees and the temple entwining. Seeing the size of the trees help to put into perspective just how old the temple is. Definitely worth a visit.

Awesome. Have seen photos that friends have taken but nothing can prepare you for seeing the Sprung trees growing over the temples. Suffering more decay than Angkor Wat but a must see if coming to this area.

Amazing place to visit. Must visit this place. Find the 'special tree' and take pictures. I can't believe how the tree grows on the temple. Be careful to touch the wall. Outside wall I saw big centipede. Wear proper shoe and bring water. Tunnel inside temple has one kind of smell. Don't forget to bring a small towel to wipe your sweat. There are 2 entrance here. Ask your tuk tuk driver to drop you at the first entrance and then pick you at the other entrance.

Amazing!!!!. We've all seen Ta Prohm aka the Tomb Raider Temple.It's majestic and stunning!Half ruined, covered in bright green moss and jungle!Another place where you could just wander around all day!Less packed than Angkor Wat so it was easier to get people free pics.
Nature at its best. This temple shows the awesome power of nature. Nested in the jungles, trees have grown around these structures adding more beauty to the scenery.

Beautiful place!. It's just so dreamy. ... with all those trees. But sad that they built an ugly wooden platform in front of the nicest spot. Where the typical tourist has to pose for various ridiculous pictures :-(
Amazing Jungle!!!. It was amazing time to visit temples especially Ta Prohm at sunrise and beautiful atmosphere.. Highly recommended!!!

Tombraider temple. The first stop on our 5 hrs in the park. Our hotel tuk tuk driver warned us not to handle the guidebooks on offer for $1 as the cheeky seller then sais its to look only and the real cost is $100! Also buying from yhe children is generally not enxouraged as it keeps them out of school. That said thw temple is jaw droppingly stunning with the tree roots draped over and through the rocks. A pile of stones? Yes but you can see the beauty that this place must have been. Peacful and tranqul. Ask hour tuk tuk deiver to let you walk through and meet him at the ither side.

Tomb Raider?. This temple is very famous because of all the trees growing inside the walls. It also very popular for the Tomb Raider movie.Due to the stated above this temple will crowded even during low season.

Tomb Raider Temple. stepping here, it brings back the past. how in the world did they built this titan in the past with so little tools? Ta Prohm was made more famous with Tomb Raider famously being climb in this temple. This is one of the few temples that is cooling even on a hot and sunny day. Mainly because the forest has " engulfed" the temple, making it one the most unique temples in Siem Reap.If you did visit Angkor Wat, which i presume you did, then Ta Phohm MUST be in your bucket list. if you didn't visit these 2 temples, then you haven't been to Cambodia

So many trees!. This was definitely the most pretty and interesting temple for me. Tomb Raider was shot here and the trees growing out of the temples make it well worth the visit. A man that lived there offered to help take our pictures and brought us to all the photogenic spots and took many photos for us. He told us that the camera crew from Tomb Raider taught him all the angles when they were there filming. Of course at the end he asked us to pay him but it was nice to have someone guide us through the temple. High recommend this temple!
Toomb Raider Temple. Amazing take time to appreciate the surroundings of this temple and not just the main attraction. Everyone trying to take photos be patient!!!
Amazing. It is amazing to see the jungle take back what was his! The tomb raider temple is definitely one of the top three in Angkor.

Definitely worth a visit . Ta Prohm is a magnificent temple and what it lacks in size it makes up for in wonder. This site provides some of the best photo opportunities of any temple in Cambodia. The structures of the temple are overburdened with trees. The vines and roots of these trees extent over the moss ridden stone and gave insight into the wonderful power of nature. It is also a great source of historical information as you gain and insight into Khmer culture. The whole site is layered with wooden paths meaning it is extremely accessible.

Pieces of Art. If you're huge fan of Tomb Raider and Indiana Jones, sure this is the place you cannot missed on your visit in Siem Reap. All the scene in the movie will be popped up when you walking around the temple. Even it looks like ruined city, but it blended so well with the old tree's root. It's so beautiful and what can I called it's really a piece of art

Our visit to Ta Prohm temple. This place is more famous from the movie Tomb raiders..excellent view of trees engulfing the temple area.Unbelievably large trees with roots as big as 1 foot in diameter.

The trees, the trees the trees. I love Ta Prohm because for me it is the best example of how nature will eventually take over.. If you have a driver, get them to meet you on the other side so you can walk through the temple..

Man vs. nature!. I found this temple to be my personal favorite! I loved how the jungle just swept over everything, and the combination between the man-made temple and nature was very powerful imagery. Just a wonderful visit for sure!
A favourite to many. Most interesting temple complex for us. Exciting history and covers a large area with multiple buildings. One of a kind with the trees taking over the temples.
Great temple. Thought we were all templed out then went to Ta Prohm.....tomb raider shot here, well a couple of scenes anyway, an interesting temple

Epic temple. Beautiful constructed temple from hundreds of years ago. Part of the day pass you get for Angkor wat. Has some amazing ancient temple meets nature scenes with old trees growing around the structure.

interesting Tree. This is very nice temple with the big tree on the temple. It's charming and I was feeling fresh when i arrived there.It's cold and fresh air with the sound of bird like music. ROMANTIC!!!!

Unimaginable view. This is the temple that you must go if you visit Siem Reap. Looking at the root of the tree on top of the temple structure you can't describe in words. You must see yourself this world wonder.
Very amazing temple and welknow.. Don't missed to visit this temple, it was great and amazing. it has a big tree growing on the temple, it may more than 100 years.
wonderful. Really enjoyed our visit - quieter than Angkor Wat and very mystical - trees growing through the ruins are well worth going to see

Best Temple in Siem Reap!!! Hands Down. Great Temple to visit! Flat and easy walk into temple! Fairly easy and safe to access and walk around for elderly and young, others temples are quite steep and dangerous, but photographically the best Temple by Far! This is the one they Filmed Tomb Raider with Angelina Jolie. Hot Tip. Temple opens at around 7.15am daily, be there then and get in with only a couple others and you will get the greatest Photos with no one else in them. By 8.30am it is busy and after that forget about it, too busy and too Hot!
Centuries old trees. just in awe of the old trees and structure. They believed that these trees are supernatural. Well, maybe and they are a great reminder to protect Mother Nature.

Trip with the Parents. You cant go to Cambodia without going yo this place! It is just amazing, a combination of man made structures and nature filling up the gaps!! Its just amazing!!! Ig you can go with a tour guide, highly recommended as to learn details and get awesome pictures of the temple

Can't be missed!. So beautiful & a very popular temple. Bring water, there is a lot of walking and it can be so hot depending on when you're there! Get a great guide so you don't miss out on all the history, for that is what makes these places truly unbelievable!! (Highly recommend Happy Angkor Tour, ask for Mr. Bun! We had an amazing experience)

The Jungle Temple, a Jewel in the Wild. This is NOT to be Missed! It is an incredible site of how Mother Nature has taken over the area. Photo oppurtunities are everywhere. Take an extra card for your camera. You will need it. As you wander around, you will see huge tree roots wrapped into the walls of the temple. You will also be able to stand inside a tree trunk. Every nook and corner has an amazing story to tell. Crumbling walls, uprooted stones, and trees make this truly a work of art from Nature. This is my favorite temple of Angkor Wat. Take water, hat, sun screen with you.

See the Dinosaur Carving. One of the best temples to see and not to miss. There is a dinosaur carving famous world wide and don't dare miss it. You will regret it if you do. I did the first trips. Now i know it is here in this temple. Take time to see this temple as it is one of the best ones there.

This was my favorite temple in Siem Reap. . Ta Prohm is the temple that you might have seen in Angelina Jolie's Tower of Doom. This most unusual temple is covered with root, trees and unique forms. Much of the stones from these ruins are strewn all over the site. It should not be attempted by handicapped folks or those that are faint of heart. These temples are a workout. However Ta Prohm is beautiful and is not to be missed.

A must to visit place. You will be refreshed when you see the fascinating view of this hidden paradise of South East Asia. We were tired walking that day but when we saw the picturesque scenery that Ta Prohm offers to its tourist, then we were relieved with what we felt. The place is really amazing!
Up with the best. I saw this while on a Peregrine tour. We went at the end of the day..No people and not so hot. What a breath taking place. It was amazing to see

Melting trees. Most memorable to me because of the silk cotton trees that seem to melt into the stone. I recommend entering via the west gate but early enough to stay ahead of the multitudes that follow.

Fascinating temple. Visited today as part of a full day tour
As the scene of the Tomb Raider movie it was one we were looking forward to
Whilst smaller than Angkor it is interesting to see a temple that is only partly refurbished

Tomb Raider temple. This is where some of the scenes in Tomb Raider Are shot. This temple is quite destroyed because of the trees! The trees are gigantic, and their roots Are growing through, over and under the walls. Nevertheless, it's beautiful! Amazing historie scene.

come for the Tomb Raider story - stay because it is so much more!. We are not huge movie buffs but apparently this is very popular because scenes from the movie Tomb Raider were filmed here which makes it popular with tourists. The history behind it, the incredible carvings, the trees that have grown up in and around the temple, it is all amazing. My husband is an avid photographer and we spent several hours there because it was so beautiful!
Enjoy but beware the crowds. mystical and magical place, try to get there without the crowds of people and relax, take time to enjoy

Tomb Raider Experience. Got to Visit the Tomb Raider Location at Ta Prohm Temple at Siem Reap Cambodia. Amazing Trees Some as wide as an oak tree, the vines at Ta Prohm cleave massive stones in two and spill over the top of temple ramparts.
Happy time. I'm have feeling excited when i'm go to the tample . I going to buy somting so cheap . I never meet. And beautiful country and great pic
Ta prohm . Very nice like in a ferrytale .. Amazing place where u can feel the past . Like to dive strait into a adventure movie . Worth a visit
My favorite temple. Very mysterious temple with the trees growing on it .No wonder they made the Tomb raider movie here.

Wow. Must see. But then again, it's just like all other temples in siem reap, all are super impressive, and all are a must see. The photos u can take with that temple swallowing trees alone is worth the trip. Please do not skip this!
Loved this place. Excellent place, surreal tree roots taking over buildings amazing and adds to the sense of meloncoly of times gone by.

Best of the temples. Loved this temple. Half submerged in jungle, it is the most atmospheric and beautiful of the temples we visited - different in scale to Angkor Wat but just as fascinating in it's own way. Go early in the morning before the tour groups arrive, and you may even get it to yourself. Not to be missed.

Terrible. This temple has been overrun by tourists trying to take a selfie with the tree growing over it. There is a waiting line for people wanting a picture. You have to work quite hard to get past the people to get a decent picture yourself and then getting out of the crowd is a even bigger nightmare... I do not recommend going to this place in high season
"angelina jolie tree". The size of the trees show how long these temples have been around. At the moment they rely on each other to stand erect and require a lot of help just to be standing.

Amazing. Unfortunately there is a lot of places that are falling down but at the same time there is a lot of restoration happening so be prepared to take your time and watch your step. It is stunning to see how the trees have just decided to grow anywhere. I think this was nearly the highlight of my visit to Cambodia.
Ta Phrom. This temple is another beautiful place. You would see the trees that have taken over the temples. The giant roots that grows through the walls.

Thomb Rider place. In times of no more Brangelina, visit one of the most fantastic sites where Angeline Jolie filmed Thomb Rider. What makes it different from the orher? The trees grow up around the walls, making it a perfect mix of human an nature.

Visit with my 5 year old daughter. This was the number one favourite for my daughter. She just loved this place. I've been several times before and still enjoy it myself. There was quite a bit of restoration work going on when we visited May 2016 so crane booms and what not in the photos but its all manageable. Kids will definitely love this temple, just need to watch them carefully on some of the elevated walkways.

Best temple besides Angkor Wat. The mix between the nature and the temple are incredible. Especially during rainy season when the moss overtakes many of the temple stones, it really gives you a man versus nature feel. The trees that have taken over the temple are also incredible to see.

Amazing. . This is probably the best temple to visit. It's the least repaired although they are starting to do repair work on it. We were there for 730am and there was no other tourist there!! The trees have over took the place!!

Another good one!. It is a bit large to visit, this temple is very attractive for me, everybody come there a lot. They really would like to take photos with the trees over the pagodas so, I cannot get a prefect photo. But, it is very great to have a chance to see it.
simply the best. this temple has been taken over by mother nature and is the most stunning temple for views pictures etc a must see all everybody , twice

the second beautiful place after angkor wat. we can se many big trees grown in many corner of this place that we can not see in another place in this world. we can feel the cool air inside of the buiding that was build by stone as the material construction with hundreeds years old. but be patient to take some photographs at the most beautiful corner of it. so many touriest will be queued to do something that you want to do too..
Tomb raider . This was our favourite temple, fewer crowds and feels like you have come across an ancient wonder in the middle of the jungle

A temple and jungle combined.. A magical place this temple is and a must visit place in siem reap. The jungle has become a part of the temple and makes ta prohm an amazing sight. Don't need as much time here as you would some other temples but it's something different and worth a visit.
lara croft. this is a great temple with the fig trees growing around some of it restoration is taking place on some parts but a must see

One of the Best; Nature Meets Ruins with Nature Winning. A Tomb Raider set, this is a large temple that's been left to nature and finally International concerns are trying to slow the destruction. The mix of the giant strangler figs intermixed with the ruins is spectacular.

My favourite Temple. We visited this almost 1000 year old temple on our fourth day in Siem Reip and it was my favourite so far! The temple is not as crowded as the other more popular sites and it seemed to be a younger crowd here. This is likely because the millennials all know that this is where Angelina Jolie's Laura Croft movie was filmed. There are many beautiful places where the grand old trees which have grown around and through the rock of the temple provide a striking reminder of the power and adaptability of nature. There are some steps which are uneven but not difficult to climb and of course, you need to have your temple pass stamped to enter. Although the day was a hot and humid scorcher, there are several areas of shade where you can sit and contemplate the beauty of the temple. It would be slippery and very hard to explore this site if it were raining.
Amazing!. I went early in the morning and there were no crowds. I had the place pretty much to myself and it was unbelievable.
Experience the Tomb Raiders domain. Yet more ancient temples that have been reclaimed from the jungle. Awesome to walk among structures thousands of years old.

Among the top 3 buildings in Angkor. While unfortunately was super-crowded with tourists, it is another must see in Angkor.This temple have different conditions of conservation than the others, since the restorers decide to let Ta Prohm almost untouched to show how they found it for the first time.It looks Raw and it is amazing to see the destructive power of nature.

Stunning. . This place is so popular because it was abandoned and trees began to grow everywhere. And that is also the reason why it is so marvelous. Don't think simply looking at the pictures will be enough, you should definitely go see it!!!

5 STAR WHAT ELSE. Apart from Tomb Raider this place has so much history and is a work in progress to preserve. You must go it is that simple and see how the jungle has claimed a spot in making this a highlight.

Temple covered with Trees. Amazing and awe inspiring.Has probably the oldest trees.The roots of Trees can be seen coming through the walls of the Temple.The movie tomb raider was shot in this temple.
Different experience to see the Nature's power.
Ta Prohm so beautifull. Don't forget visiting ta prohm temple it amazing one also this temple is tohm rider movie .had a lot the tree on the top up temple .
A must see. The sheer magnificence of nature. Roots growing over stone.also a great deal of history behind this. Great photos. A wonderful family outing.
Great. Yeap, it is great. Unique experince that one shouldn't miss. At every corner, on every stone you will see a detail...

The tree growing temple.. This temple is a magnificent work. There are trees growing all over the walls of the temple , 13 in total. Restoration work is being done by the Indians and hence there are proper signages and also the description of the temple. I think this is by far the second best temple after Angkor wat in this city. A must visit. Visit afternoon so that you get to feel the canopy of the trees properly.

Amazing experience . Came to this temple area as last of my day tour and was glad it was left till last!! Such an amazing mixture of architecture and mature intertwined. And well preserved. Once in a lifeTime, you have to see it in person
Amazing. I have a wonderful trip to this place, I was so impressed with the existence of the temple and tree roots which grow creeping centuries.
Absolutely stunning. This is amazing. Stunning temple with all the trees and roots growing over and through the temples. Just like you see int he pictures.

Mystic and beautiful. It's fantastic to walk around in the ruins of Ta Prohm. The tree roots embracing the ruins gives a mysterious sense of feeling. If you go a bit away from the others you can feel the peace and calm from the nature.Ta Prohm is not far from Angkor Wat or Angkor Thom so get a guide to take you or just take a tuk tuk and walk around for yourself. I would love to go there early morning when it is more quiet and not so many other tourists.

Same, same but very Different!. We thought it would be the same as Angkor Wat or Angkor Thom.....wrong.Just stunning, as everywhere you went, every corner you turned around there was another just amazing sight. Cannot describe how beautiful this place is with the trees entwined through the temple.Not many steps so if you do have trouble walking, go here, it's a little easier than Angkor Wat.

Magnificent. The trees intertwining with the stone structures makes for a nearly mythical and magical sight - the magnificence of nature woven into man-made structures. And each one is more beautiful than the next, leaving you in awe at these sights. Certainly one of the highlights of my day of visiting the temples.

Truly special . This was my favorite of all the temples, could of happily spent a whole day here. We found crowds weren't to bad if you get here a little earlier instead of having it third on the regular tour guide list. Highly recommended

Temple and Jungle Intertwined. This temple isn't as big as the more famous Angkor Wat, but is fascinating in its own way. The fragility of the site means that it can never be fully freed of the trees that have enveloped over the site over the centuries. Yet these same trees now add to the whole aura and, particularly approaching dusk, make for some wonderful photo opportunities.

A Must visit. This is the place got famous through Tom Raider movie and has the got the roots of the gigantic tree over the temple. The roots are so beautiful you would be astonished how on earth it found its way to the ground. More than 3 trees combining together and its rots widespread across. Good for Photography and would recommend not to miss this.
The Jungle Takes What It Wants. We loved this temple. "Tomb Raider" lived us to its billing and provided outstanding photographic opportunities and a bit of mystery. Don't miss this Temple!

Beautiful to see nature and structure together. This temple is naturally beautiful. It's amazing on how the natural forming of the trees over the temple structures.This temple was my favorite at Angkor Wat.
Best temple. From all the temples i have seen, this is my favourite. ruin temple with strangle tree roots going through the ruins. If you are a keen photographer you will have a great time here!
Be amazed by the trees!. We saw Angkor Wat, Angkor Thom and Ta Prohm in the same day, three very different temples. All stand out in their own right, don't miss them!

Where organic meets inorganic. At first glance, you'll note that many of the stone structures here are a mess, broken and scattered everywhere. Take a closer look and you'll see that trees play a greater role in the complex than in others. There are a few cases of some fantastically overgrown trees that have entirely enveloped the stone, eliciting images of some strange tentacle monster.As of Sept 2016, there is continuing work to put the broken pieces together, including, sadly, some tree removal activity. All this is being done to "stabilize" the structures, such that they're protected from further deterioration. Pay attention especially to the route here, as it is perhaps the easiest place in the Angkor complex to get lost (and miss out on some great sights).Most likely, you'll be visiting other places in the Angkor complex on the same day. I'd strongly advise visitors to bring at least one spare battery, as there will be almost nowhere you can charge your equipment.

Interesting. As all the locals will tell you, this is the location Tomb Raider was filmed. (They are very proud of this fact)Did not have a tour guide to start with but a staff member took it upon himself to accompany us and provided some insightful commentary and stories as well as being our official photographer :) Not sure if he was expecting payment, but we gave him $5 at the end of the "tour" which was well received and well worth it.Smaller temple than Angkor Wat but different and definitely worth visiting.Keep an eye out for the dinosaur carving...

Great temple entangled in the trees' roots. Must see. Very special atmosphere, unfortunately spoiled by the crowd. You should come here early in the morning or late in the afternoon to avoid the crowd and enjoy the "Mystery of the Lost Arch"

The laws of nature!. Another amazing temple where you can enjoy both the beauty of the temple and also the beauty of the strength of nature. Incredibly large trees that have taken over the site. Very peaceful place!
Nice day trip. Bring your camera, lots to see, and lots of amazing things to snap some shots. Also helps to carry a bottle of water with you on this trek.

Many trees still intertwine the structures. I no longer looks like the movies, but Many trees still intertwine the structures - rightfully so, or many structures would not still be there. It is still well worth the visit, but one no longer can feel like one is the first to see it.
Amazing. Ta Prohm is a great place to visit. The tree grow out of the temple look amazing , is a good place to take photo

Angelina Jolie and the ancient trees. You will be amazed not by the temple but by the ancient, gigantic trees. They are not something you will see everyday. Some of them are so huge until you fear to stand close to them. There is a particular tree trunk need to be support to prevent it from damaging the structure of the temple.
Look out, Lara Croft!. Of course we had to visit the temple made famous from the Tomb Raider movies. It did not disappoint! Mysterious & beautiful.

Amazing tree roots grown into the temple. The so called "tomb raider temple" is a must see on any visit to the temples. It's a lovely spot, and gives a good idea what the Angkor complex looked like before building were restored. But be patient waiting your turn to take photographs beside the many trees that grow out of this temple.

Beautiful!. Also known as the Tomb Raider Temple from the movie, this temple was beautiful! The trees really make this temple have so much character and beauty. There was a small queue to have a photo at the famous viewpoint, but it went quickly.

Beautiful temple. This was by far our favourite temple. The trees and greenery around it add to its aura. The locals like to emphasise that it is the location for the Tomb Raider movie but walking through it gives a sense of the time and age of when it was built. Must do.

Highlight of the trip - fewer touts & begges. I mostly took video so only have a couple of photos to share. Although this was the most peaceful part of the day - it's not enough to encourage me to return, ever.

Straight out of Indiana Jones!. If you only have a limited time to explore the Angkor Wat / Angkor Thom site, don't miss Ta Prohm, where nature has truly overtaken man made structures in overgrown trees wrapped around collapsed temple walls. Fresh out of scenes from Tomb Raider and Indiana Jones won't be far fetched. Ta Prohm probably also gives visitors a perspective of how the original Angkor Wat site probably looked liked nearly a century ago when it was first discovered. Surreal visit, seeing nature running riot.

Most mystical temple.. If you have time to visit Angkor Wat only for a one day, then Ta Prom is one of the must see temples to go. Very mystical trees growing trough the walls, hundreds of picture options, take your time and lots of water with you - always very hot place, big trees not much wind.

3rd and last, trees growing over and though these ruins. Our last stop for the day, restoration taking place as with the other sites, imagine the 20 US fee which covers the 3 sites goes into restoration costs,

Wonderful temple ruins. Its a temple where nature tries to reclaim. Roots grow deep into the structure so there are dangers of them collapsing in the future. Book your tickets there now before its too late. Hire a good tour guide. There many guides of many different languages. Also, make sure you enter the temple from the correct entrance. Ask for assistance.

trees and treesssssss. It's amazing to see how nature overtake this temple, you can see gigantic tree surrounding and crawled over the temple. It is great place for picture. This is movie set for Tomb Raider too. But it can be slippery during raining day

Tomb Raider Temple! Awesome.. This place looks surreal. It is the Tomb Raider temple. I loved seeing all the tree roots growing out, on top of, over, and through the temple walls. If it's crowded with a tour group, just circle around and come back. It'll be worth it to get those great photos without a ton of people surrounding your shot.

ABSOLUTELY YES. One of the most beautiful and inspiring places I've ever seen, besides the beauty of the temples, the history and the sculptures that surround you, come completely enthralled by the spectacle of the jungle that slowly is covering and supporting the temples ....A must see

Let your inner explore run wild - Temple ruins, massive tree overgrowth. Easy to get to and a comfortable walk around. This temple was striking by its 800 year old history with fallen structures everywhere and massive 400 year trees with winding trunks taking over the site. For photographers, you will love the filtered sunlight. My friends and I visited without a tour guide. You can spend 45 mins to 2hrs there.
Cambodian Holiday.. It is amazing how nature will reclaim structures if neglected.Enjoy as part of a movie set.Angela Jolie has a special interest interest in this site.
Treeeee..... The way tree has grown around the place is like wow... When we went restoration was in process. Its a huge complex and you are surprised by it as it has grown so huge. Must visit.

Tomb Raider!. This is where the film "Tomb Raider" was shoot. A must visit for your Siem Reap trip! The temple is magnificent with all the trees growing on top of it. You have to be there to experience the greatness!

Mossy ruins and trees. This smaller temple is pretty much still being restored. Famous for that big tree, there is really nothing much else, well compared to angkor wat and bayon. Loved how moss has taken over the temple creating an eerie yet peaceful visit.

Was in repair while we were there. While we were there it was under recosntruction so you could not see a lot of it but it is still a top visit. I'd almost do this backwards start at the end of the line of temples and work back to avoid the crowd of tours.
Man vs Nature. All those trees, slowly taking back what is theirs, and look at the temple trying to stand up against nature, but gradually losing the battle, be awed...
The most authentic temple. In my opinion its the most beutiful temple in the Angkor Wat area. Like from different world. A must see.

Outstanding and wxciting. I thought of all the temples we saw, including the Angkor Wat, Ta Prohm is the breathtaking site to view- it's the trees! How for 5-600 years these roots have twined themselves around and through the blocks of the temple is just breathtaking! I loved this!

Rambling and ramshackle, but one of our favourites of the temple sites. Ta Prohm was the last of the temple sites we visited on our day at the Angkor Wat complex near Siem Reap. It was rather rambling and ramshackle, but was one of our favourites of the temple sites. It includes the iconic 'temple in the trees'.
Fun for Tomb Raider fans.. I really enjoyed this temple. Especially the way the tress grow through it. It is well worth a visit.
Best one. It was Tohm rider one .this temple amazing with big tree caver on the temple .but very busy it a lot chinese

Unbelievable. I have never seen the Tomb Raider movie so my level of reference visiting this site was non existent - however I was awestruck to see the trees growing out, through and around the ruins.

An interesting contrast to Angkor Wat. Amazing interaction between architecture and nature. To see what has developed and feel that it is still going on in your own presence. If you like trees and temples this is a good spot to visit, possibly a little cooler than other sites because of the shade but maybe the humidity can get up sometimes?

Most picturesque. A picturesque temple/monastery complex good to view and photograph in the afternoon sun. Give yourself plenty of time. This complex was part of a huge city (the temple occupies only 1 hectare of a 60 hectare city/complex. There is much to see. Unless you have a guide I strongly recommend checking a good guidebook beforehand to ensure you see the most spectacular aspects

Another amazing temple in Cambodia.. When you plan a visit to Ta Prohm prepare to be amazed, this is my third visit and it still intrigues me, beautiful carvings, trees growing what seems to be out of the walls.True tomb raider experience, if visiting Siem Reap this is one temple that should be on your "must visit list"

morning visit_ nice & quiet. reserve `40min to look around ( more if you taking photos) , polarizer is a must and do it rather early in a day , so you have more room to move abound with no "bystanders on your shots"

Outstanding for the Explorer! Life is about adventure.... One of the best temples and I've been to 15 of the Angkor Temples. Angkor Wat is full of artistic work but this temple is for the explorer! Nature and man comes together here. The trees become part of the ancient buildings to form one of natures artistic forms of beauty.  If it rains its worth putting on rain gear because the beauty comes out. I'm a professional photographer and the contrast, reflections and colors all come out for outstanding photographs. Visit my website for dining ideas in Siem Reap. travelfoodhealth.comI've been to this temple 4 times so far...

The famous Tomb Raider temple. Jam-packed with tourists. Every carving was handmade and the history is unique. The trees sprouting in the temple itself are amazing. Temple stairs could be steep and dangerous.
Wonderful . The place is amazing and my favourite template by far. The place has a mythical air about it. Just go and see it for yourself.

Visited this amazing place and it was better than I imagined. Was like being in an enchanted forest.. This was our first visit to Ta Prohm and I was awestruck at how the trees could grow right over the temple. You really felt you were in a magical place. Was my favourite and should not be missed.

Beautiful Ruins. This is the third temple we visited after Angkor Wat and Angkor Thom and it is worth the time if you can go as well. The three temples took us about 6 hours. This is not as massive as the other two temples, but has its own unique appeal. This temple is unique because of all the trees that are growing out of the temple ruins.
Best one. This was our favourite of many many temple's that we saw around angkor. The trees growing through were incredible, don't know how they're still up

Truly Stunning. This was my favourite Temple. To see the enormous trees growing over and above the temples is a site to see with so many photo opportunities, there is restoration work going on but this is not an issue. There are so many nooks and crannies to explore.

Most unusual site. I think this is the temple where the fig trees have grown into the temple walls giving it a total jingle like effect. Again would have a guide for the visit so you can fully understand the history
Part of the temple circuit . This temple is part of the more popular temples group. It is easily accessible by tuktuk however you need to buy the temples pass (currently USD$20)
Even better than the pictures!. You will have seen photos of one or two of these amazing trees, but there are many! This temple does not disappoint. An absolute highlight of our trip to Cambodia.
Ta Prohm - the overgrown temple. Fascinating to see nature combining with ancient architecture. Some magnificent trees growing over, through and around the temple.

Nice, but... It is a really nice combination of ruin temples and nature. However, overrated due to a single movie, as the quality of the temple does not compare to others. If short of time, I would first visit other temples
Tomb rider fame. Visited this place as tomb rider movie was shot here.... Great place to be in... Overall a good experience

Beautiful. a must see !
if youre imaginative enoug, you can make out the filming of Tomb Raider in your head! ;)

My favorite part of Siem Reap. We were part of a larger tour van group where they drop you and your English speaking guide at the front gate. that was where we went wrong, our guide spoke horrible English and we think he was a bit.... well.... shouldn't be driving a van full of tourists. Anyways, when you enter its human nature to follow the crowd especially with all the desctruction of the temple but the line was so long and it was so hot out. When I saw a nice Cambodian man waving for me and my friend to follow him to the left instead of the right, I hopped at the opportunity to have better photos without the thousands of Asian tourists with selfie sticks. He was engaging and his English wasn't perfect but much better than the guy we had already paid for so I stuck with him at all costs. a guy in our group refused to join after a moment saying "he will demand money when this is over" and my retort was "good, he deserves it for his services" and I was spot on right!! He lined up all the shots, took photos of me and my friends. he was very kind and trust worth for a stranger. I ended up getting hundreds of shots with no other people in them. We pooled all our spare cash while he wasn't looking and when he started a fake sob story about a sick mother in another country, we smiled and handed all the money without hesitating, he smiled and looked relieved that it wasn't going to be a fight. It ended up being about $10-12 I believe and he cried when he counted and hugged us all. He worked very hard and gave us a service, he earned that money. Anyways....We learned that although the trees had been growing for more than 300 years, most of the destruction was due to the bombs during the Vietnam war hitting areas near by. Very sad history but amazing visual to remind us what that history is.Most of the tours have this location towards the later of the day as Ankgor Wat is the sunrise party. Please note that its very very hot and very little shade, make sure you have water when you get there. there are a few tented shops at the end with coconuts and water but they are at the end. I went through both of my bottles of water before that point.Find the dinosaur... research the dinosaur before you get there. super cool and kinda spooky!
Awesome trip. Really good visit. spent close to 1 and a half hours walking around as my guide gave me explanations and showed me through the ruins. Great time.
Wow- I'm Laura Croft. Wow- it's very beautiful. Bring mosquito repellant. Bring a camera & good walking shoes. Take your time. There's a LOT to see. Grab a coconut.

One of the most extraordinary . This temple is simply incredible, I would highly recommend visiting and spending quite a bit of time here as it is so large. We had to rush round which spoilt it for us as we needed to get back to the hotel.

My favourite temple in Siem Reap (the Tomb Raider temple). Ta Prohm is the temple area from the movie Tomb Raider. It is also known as the Mother temples. It is a stunning example of nature taking over man made structures with the roots integrating with the stone work to form an amazing fusion of trees and stone. You will love it.
Reclaimed by nature. This temple is unique in that it is as found years ago and shows you how much has been done by many to restore the other temples in the area from being overgrown
My favorite Temple!. The color of the initial Temple is amazing and the tree and the roots that's growing/embedding it self into the Temple is just amazing.
Great history . This temple is great for the trees alone great photos it shows how they were over come many years ago by the jungle

A must aside from Angkor Wat. This is a sight to behold. The overgrown tress gave the place a unique setting. Appreciated it with a guide who told us a lot of things about this temple and how to visit it avoiding the other tourists.
Tomb Raider Temple. Really amazing temple. The trees growing around the old buildings are incredible. This was also the sight of the movie Tomb Raider which is a fun piece of trivia.

I have never seen Tomb Raider.... So all the hot spots were lost on me. But it didn't matter because this place is UNREAL. It's like you are transported to an ancient and alien world where trees grow on buildings and everything is tinged green. Don't forget your wide brimmed hat and sun protection, although this location affords you with MUCH more cool shade while outside than the other temple locations!
huge. it is surprising to see the size of this temple complex. they could do a little more conservation though. parts of it are just piles of cut stone
Tomb Raider. Nature prevails - it might resort to drastic measures to contain us ie. droughts, floods etc., but nature - always prevails. Awesome to see the trees mingled with the structures.

As Angkor Wat but not so much restored. It's one of the largest complexes of Angkor Thom city. Certain parts are still in good condition, others are more like how most temples were found during their re-discovery. Ta Prohm is an amazing few hours spending wandering through the mystic of the ancient Khmer kingdom. A genuine must-see.

My favorite temple. With all the trees overgrowing the temple of Ta Prohm, this was my favorite!It looks like out of a movie or a computer game. It's surreal and really fascinating. If you go to Angkor, don't miss this temple!
unusual. A great display of time and heritage. The ever changing look of the temples keeps you interested . Not too big.
A must see. This is another must see temple at Siem Reip and it is worth the time to visit. you can visit the main temples in one day.

Fantastic!. The sort of place you dream about, see in films, or even documentaries etc. then are actually at one! A beautiful tree-temple combination that is stunning and brings up all sorts of thoughts and feelings about man and nature, who we are and what are we doing here, but mostly visually and I guess climatically we had an experience of a lifetime.

Incredible mother nature . This temple is also known as the temple ruined by trees. Well if it wouldn't have been ruined it was not going to be this famous I guess. If you visit Seam Reap make sure you visit this temple too!
Less visited but equally beautiful. Although less visited is equally beautiful and absolutely worth visitng as every single temple in Angkor. Very misterious and particular.

My ABSOLUTE favorite temple. I love the jungle and I love temples. So seeing a temple being devoured by the jungle was unbelievable. Nature has taken over a Ta Phrom and in some of the structures, it's nature keeping it all together. I meditated at this place in a quite corner and it was a magical experience. If you don't want to see many temples, but still see the best ones.. don't miss out on Ta Phrom. Spend at least 2 hrs here.
The most impressive temple for our family. We liked this temple very much, beautiful surrouding nature.Our guide, Pal Saruon, gave an excellent tour and took great pictures.

Incredible Trees. Despite the magic of Angkor Wat, this was my favourite temple. It has a remarkable "feel" and the trees with their roots growing over, through and under the walls conjure up all sorts of shapes including a snake's body and your mother-in-law's bum!!! It is of course the tomb raider one but it's charm goes way beyond that claim to fame.

Trees&Temples&Tomb Raider. A must see for anyone visiting Angkor Wat temples. Although this is most known as The Tomb Raider movie film location you need to go and see the 300 year old trees that have submersed themselves amongst the building. Be on the lookout for a smiling face between roots on one of them! A great temple experience.
Nature wins. Photos galore again, incredible tree roots among the stones. And different from the others, so much variation.

Nice temple with big tree!. We really love this temple a lots because so cool area with big tree around and those big tree so beautiful specially is the temple that made movie of Tomrader we wish to come for long time ago.Thanks our driver take us there.
Amazing Ta Prohm!!!. its amazing temple, you can see big tree top of the temple, the root was around the temple. i think this is the best temple in angkor wat.

Enchanting . This temple is truly unique, the roots and branches of the trees growing through the temple are breathtaking and have to be seen to be believed. Another fascinating temple to visit on your tour.
best temple. The unstoppable force of nature..... it really puts things into perspective! Totally worth the trip, early morning is best, and good light for pictures!

Amazing place. Surrounded by Tropical forest and high trees, this place is definitely worth to see. Known from the shooting of Lara Croft movie. I would recommended from the architecture and the Amazing atmosphere once you sees it.

The temple where they shot Tomb Raider. In this temple in Angkor Wat they left the trees so you can see how they grew and damaged the temples over centuries. The other temples open for visitors have been more restored and visiting this one will give you an idea of how it must have felt when these magnificent monuments were first "rediscovered". In another movie there is a scene where a tiger jumps in a window and you will see this area also. Your guide will show you.

Amazing !!!.
