All the temples at Angkor Wat are not too be missed and if you cannot do them all this one is a must to add on to the ones on your itinerary,it really stretches the imagination to see all the trees and roots covering parts of the temple,it makes you imagine what it must have felt like to see it all when it was discovered,obviously a lot of the root system would have to have been removed to discover what they were covering but the ones remaining give you a good insight into how it may have looked.

Enchanting!. This is another must-see place in Siem Reap. You will be fascinated when you see this temple up-close and personal. Imagine the intrusion of giant trees into the structures that happened centuries ago and seem to be part of the temple itself, thus creating an enchanting, hypnotic archaelogical treasure that must be preserved for the succeeding generations.

Must see in Siem Reap. By far the best temple to see. The trees are just amazing. Good tip-try to visit right at noon. Tour buses are busy having lunch and you have the ruins to yourself. Our tour guide recommended an early lunch and it turned out perfect!

The "Tomb Raider" temple - crowded but a must-see anyway. I always try to avoid crowds, but they are hard to avoid in Ta Prohm, mainly thanks to the Tomb Raider 1 movie, which made it famous.I will not repeat what other fellow travelers already wrote, I will just say that this is one of the temples that need to be on your Angkor Wat short list. It has a very decent architecture and the overgrown trees make it truly unique.It is a pity that more and more of the temple is "protected" by poles and rope, this makes photography much more difficult (although there are many places for great unobstructed pictures still available... if you are lucky to find a moment with no or little people around). But this is a price of popularity I guess (and most of the temple is accessible anyway).

Most amazing experience . This was my favorite of all the temples. The children (3,5) did amazingly well with the full day tour and our driver accommodated them by splitting the day in half so they could have a break. It was just like a big fairy garden for the kids and adults. Truly amazing!

Not just another Temple. This place is also known as the Jungle Temple. The most distinctive feature of this site is how the trees seem to grow out of the ruins in a kind of mystical symbiotic union between man and mortar. It's hardly surprising that they decided to film Laura Croft Tomb Raider here. This site is not as well known as the Angkor Wat temple which means that there are a lot less people. here. Very well worth a visit.
Very Amazing temple. Ta Prohm temple was big and amazing one ,with big tree cover on the top.but a bit busy one it a lot people .

Visions of Tomb Raider. A feeling of discovery in a long forgotten temple taken over by the jungle. For the best experience try the end of the day when crowds have left and the place has a quiet, eerie feel about it as the sun begins to get lower in the sky and shadows spread. Not the fine detailed carvings of other temples but more the atmosphere which attracts.

Tomb Raider Temple. This temple can get really busy and as it is smaller that Angkor Wat means at time patience is needed. It is also undergoing restorative work, but still a beautiful, breathtaking Temple, with nature and structure combined it really is a must see.
Amazing wonder if nature. Ta Promh is an amazing wonder of nature while trees destruct the buildings but the result is so picturesque and worth a visit.

Very good. Or as its better known tomb raider temple!Very good and a very busy temple to visit.It looks just as it does in the film and pictures it's a pretty amazing site to see and you can just feel the atmosphere here.If in Cambodia I would visit again and would recommend you make time to visit this temple on your visit

Jawdropping Sight. This place is different since it is not a mountain-like shaped like the other Khmer temples in the area. First thing you'll see to enter is walking under several big trees before meet the main entrance. My mind amazed on how the nature taking over the building, merging trees with stones. Most of the structure are already old and some are waiting to crumble but are supported with steel frames. Lots of rehabilitation works being done during our visits there. There's also a spot where the Lara Croft movie were taken, but I'm not realised it until return from that place. So recognise it first if you want to pose yourself there.

tomb raiders scenery. As the guide informed us this is the temple where the Tomb Raider movie with Angelina Joli was filmed. It is a natural film set. Giant trees have grown among the ruins in the past centuries. The roots are interbreaded with the walls and rooftops forming a single entity. Fallen stones, passages, carved relief statues, offer a dramatic scenery for photo shooting. It is really enjoyable and has much less step climbing than other temples.
Not to be missed!. The trees here are absolutely amazing, make sure that you check out Ta Prohm! Absolutely incredible!

Perfect for children. Our son loved this Temple. With the trees and watching the nature work within the temple. My friend told me that this will be awesome and you feel like in the Jungle Book.She is absolutly right, you do.

A Must Visit. As the Tomb Raider Temple we had to visit this one for Mr PH if nothing else.Absolutely worth seeing, an amazing balance of being restored and being taken over by the jungle. There is one shot that everyone lines up for - having not seen the movie I assume it is featured in it? The line moves quickly though and we took the obligatory shot.A tip - our guide used the panorama setting on the iPhone to take a vertical panorama, thus getting all of the huge trees into our shots vertically - he's obviously done it before - its a great shot!
Nature at its best. Excellent place to capture pictures and study how nature balance the eco. every monument and pillars has a story to reveal.

Great But SO Crowded!. This temple was one of my favorites as it has the gorgeous colors, tree roots and history. But it is overcrowded with Chinese tourists and if you want to see it undisturbed, make sure you get there before the giant hoards of tour buses show up at 8am.

Wicked place but a little busy. We got the ta prohm temple at about 10:30 am and it is well worth a visit. The only downside is that it was very busy with lots of people posing for photos so perhaps there is Quieter time to visit?

Go early to avoid the crowds. Many tourists head to Angkok Wat to see the sunrise then go back to their hotels for breakfast. This is the time to visit this temple. I left my hotel at 7am and there were very few people when I got there which changes the experience totally.There is a classic picture of a tree overgrowing the temple that you see online everywhere. There are in fact many more of these and equally impressive. For me this was the 2nd best temple I visited, after Mealea.
Touring. A place can never miss by traveller ,tree roots have overtaken the site ,enjoyed exploring .super shots .

Totally amazing!!!!!. This temple totally amazed me, can see why it was used in the movie Tomb Raider. The trees growing through everything is a real sight and one not to be missed . This is a must visit temple and it is no wonder it is so busy. Try and beat the crowds there as it can get really busy. The day we were there it wasn't to bad and we managed to get photos without too many people in them. I could have stayed here all day taking photos , everywhere you looked it was like Wow!!.

Nature slowly taking over.. Famous for the trees growing through the buildings and walls and slowly tearing the place apart, this is a truly incredible place.The rather futile and insignificant efforts of man to restore this wonder quicker than nature can destroy it is a bit upsetting. It feels like it won't be safe for visitors for much longer.It's super popular and so attracts lots of tour groups. The route through the temple can get a bit congested. Still, you have to see it.
Had to visit Ta Prohm and were not disappointed. This was amazing and of course made famous by the Lara Croft movie Tomb Raider - had a wonderful guide and he told us some great things - recommended

Amazing!. This was the 3rd temple we visited yesterday. We chose to go by car with a driver and English speaking guide. Bannak was so knowledgeable about every temple we saw. A lovely man who went out of his way to take us different ways to avoid the big tour groups and easier access to the temples. Answered many questions from my husband and made sure he didn't rush us at any point. Many people did it alone so choice is yours. Cost through hotel was $60 U.S pp. Plus $20 U.S for one day pass pp. be aware it is VERY hot so bring a hat and sunscreen. Hotel driver provided cool wet towels and cold water through the day. We arranged to leave at 7am, to beat the worst of the heat, and had breakfast at hotel at 6am beforehand. The tour finished by 1pm so it is a long, hot and fairly strenuous day! Well worth seeing though

Naturrreee. Anyone else felt the need to crawl in and go Indiana Jones? Quite a bit of humans walking around though so not as epic. Still, the place was pretty serene. I smelled something rancid for a second though therefore not perfect...
loved it. trees look like they are wrapped in silk they are shinny and shimmering and the root structures are massive taking over the stone structures its amazing how big these trees are

Amazing place take the 3 day pass in a week it's huge. The Temples of Siem Reap are world class. .For its time to be so big and so much is amazing.. I took the 3 visits in 7 day pass and still didn't have time to see every thing.. Tuk tuk deals for many days visit are all the go... I can ride a bike if you for.. or hire a Moto..there are heaps of good shops..T shirt shops.. drink sellers.. and don't forget the cocunut ice creams..
Amazing temple but with a lot of tourists. Excellent temple to notice the nature how it hugs the temple. Because of the Lara Croft have in mind that it might be a bit crowd, but it is a must see

An awesome temple. We called this the Tomb Raiders and Two Brothers site and it is stunning with trees growing from temples and surrounded by massive century old trees. This is one to take your time, sit and soak up the surrounds. Some times with the temples, less is best so choose the ones you really want to see and this is a must for the list.
Amazing temple!. It's like a temple that decorated from nature. You will see the root of Banyan Tree on the Ta Prohm Temple evry where like it's there since the beginning when the temple was built.

Fascinating temple . Accompanied by a personal guide from Insider Journeys to 3 temples all with amazing history - not to be missed. Incredible history here - tie it in with the museum and you will understand so much more about Cambodia's ancient past , and wonderful future

Tomb raider temple was pretty amazing . You've seen the photos of the trees and so on, but this is still pretty amazing in person. Lots of good photos. Taking a guide helps with finding good photo spots and some history

Tomb Raider Fans. This is one of the "must see" temple. Unique in a way as the root of the trees overgrown the temple. Small temple, good for photography but try it go early. Recommend for 1st place of the day to tour.

Those tree roots...... Ta Prohm has a special history but is most memorable for the huge tree roots that have invaded the sandstone buildings over several centuries. Many people will be familiar with the tree root images but there is a lot to see amongst the ruins. I suggest you engage a guide though, as it can be difficult to discern the different features from some of the other temple sites.

Marvel at Mother Nature & her victory over human civilization.. Ever wonder how nature punish or eat up human civilization? The many giant trees growing and crushing these amazing man build tomb tells a lot of what nature can do to abandon civilization.Hire a good tour and you'll learn many things. Like how it support various ecosystem, local beliefs, legends and tales about the trees, and great location for panorama photo shoot.Recommend to come during sunrise or sunset because majority of the tour group would be watching sunrise and sunset elsewhere leaving this place serene & great chances for wonderful photoshoots without being photobombed.

Obsessive Lara Croft types. This is the iconic trees growing over temple Temple. Very crowded with lots of photo enthusiasts. It is a kind of must see, but the same effect is visible in a few other temples without the armies of tourists

Must see. This along with the other sites I would say is a put it on your bucket list. Wonderful and memorable. Get a personal guide it's worth it. Note that to do all the temples in one day you will walk 15 odd KS and climb up some pretty scary stairs (more like ladders)

Unique. Ta Prohm should not be missed. It has been left in its natural state for many years and is now in the process of being restored, but the growth of the trees and the exposure of the root system throughout this temple make it uniquely special to visit.

Loved it. You honestly feel like your discovering things for the first time despite this been one of the busiest temples. Head straight to it at 5am and you'll get a period of relative calm before the tour buses arrive. If you're a photographer you'll need a 18mm lens or wider to do it justice as a lot of the features have fences or ropes near to them and at least this way you can get in closer.
A must see. The wonder of the tree roots winding their way between the stones of the temple structure is so much greater in person than seen only in photographs. Just amazing in so many ways.

Underwhelmed. The main attraction of this temple is that it has trees that are huge. Pretty much it. Otherwise it is just look alike other temples. Not very impressive, but still do make as much use of your ticket as much as possible and drop by this temple.

giant giant trees. Clearly, Mother Nature has taken over. These structures won't be standing without these trees supporting them. Look out for the "lucky lady" hiding between the roots of the strangling tree.

Nature fights back!. You know those pictures you've seen with the trees growing out of the temple? They're all real and not photo-shopped at all!This place is incredible. The next thing to say is that I found it really easy to get lost in here (and I've got a good sense of direction!)...so get a guide, if you can. Ta Prohm is a load of crumbling towers/buildings/courtyards that in some places are being held up by the tree growing through them. In other places the tree is on top of them or wrapped around them...it really is quite a sight to behold. Some of the buildings/ruins are also covered in moss...This really adds to the place. So much character! Ideally you'll need at least an hour to take it all in.

Amazing temple. This temple was incredible. My sister and I were so moved by this area, we sat down and meditated within its ruins...the most amazing feeling came over me...being amongst these ruins that are being reclaimed by the forest...a must place to visit, and sit a while

Impressive. We spent a whole day touring the main temple sites in the area all of which were really impressive. All worth a visit and if you can get a local guide to escort you round all the better.Our holiday was an escorted tour with Trailfinders and each of the guides we had on the separate legs of the holiday were impressively knowledgeable and provided excellent commentary around each site visited, they also answered all my stupid questions!
Must visit. Among all the temples in Siem reap this was the BEST ...it was very very impressive and fascinating ... It's a must visit place
Yip, it is surreal. It is surreal to see how these trees grow through and over the stone temple. It is definitely worth the visit
Absolutely stunning . Angkor Wot is beautiful, but this was even better! The mix of incredible buildings and absolutely stunning nature made this our highlight of the day.
this is much more the angkor wat. angkor wat was nice but the best feeling i got at ta prohm where trees grow over the ruins and the photos are amazing

Still amazing. Siem Reap is blessed with a lot of temples from the Khmer empire and for me Ta Prohm is definitely the favourite. While Bayon impresses with the tower-faces and Angkor Wat is an architectural wonder of the world, Ta Prohm has an ambience like nothing else. The abandoned temple, reclaimed by nature before rediscovered and now partially cleaned makes you stop and think and the impressions will stay with you for a long, long time.

The power of Nature. This is a must see! Very impressive remains of an ancient temple invaded by massive jungle growth and only recently uncovered. Good agility required to manage the steps and walkways. Serves as a good warning to keep your garden at home under control!

Temple with many picture-worthy spots. The temple has a lot of spots (with trees, roots, corners) good for picture-taking. It opens at 7:30 in the morning. You have to be there early in the morning to avoid the crowd for you to have enough time for picture-taking. This is under restoration by the Cambodian and Indian governments. Worthy of a visit and recommendation to others.
Awesome, ancient city. Our second trip to Angkor. Still saw things we missed the 1st time. Always impressed with the details of the structures and the architect design.

Trees Are The Stars . An interesting site in an area overflowing with interesting sites. The trees that have taken root in, and over, the walls and buildings are fascinating and spectacular. They give a very clear insight into how the jungle can reclaim the ground it's lost. Well worth visiting.

Huge trees!!!. Huge trees growing within buildings must be hundreds of years old. Quite the sight as the roots snake around the buildings to create a spectacular view. The temple like others in Siem Reap is being renovated though in my opinion not to the quality of what it was.

Busy, busy temple and very beautiful. A lovely temple near Angkor Wat, you need to buy a ticket to the Angkor archeological area for here. It's very busy, partly for the eerie way the trees have grown up through the buildings, and partly because parts of the film Tomb Raider were filmed here. A must visit for Siem Reap.

Majestical!!! Just simply awesome!. We did a small tour of the 4 main temples in a day. Ta phrom is very beautiful. The humongous trees around the temple make it even more awesome. Weather is really hot and humid around the temple but definitely didnt stop us exploring the area. Highly recommend it!
Cool temple amazing pics. This temple is so different, you'll enjoy exploring all the hidden treasures. The trees are amazing, great for photos.
The most beautifull one. We loved this temple. There is so much to be seen around Angkor wat. This overgrown temple is an impressive one. Also much more extended as I expected.
Amazing. This was my favourite out of angkor wat, bayon etc absolutely loved it. It did get a bit busy when we qaa going round ir and had to queue for a photo by the main bit but only 5 mins

Amazingly romantic. The myth of a long-lost and elaborately decorated temple submerged by the jungle defines Ta Prohm. Lara Croft’s Tomb Raiders gave it a more recent gloss. The (Indian) renovation team had a massive job to do to rebuild collapsed galleries and towers, They had the aesthetic sensibility to compromise historical accuracy to keep in place some of the more spectacular ficus trees which had insinuated themselves amid the stones. The result is an attractive maze of galleries, courtyards, face towers, enigmatic representation of a dino, all in the shade of the canopy provided by giant trees. Ta Prohm attracts the crowds – logical. We did two visits, the second one in the golden light of late afternoon. Magical, with alternatively a warm feeling of familiarity and the satisfaction to discover things we had missed the first time.
Go tjhere first thing in the morning. You absolutely need to go there first thing in the morning to really get a feel for the place without people.

The "tomb raider" temple. A nice change from the perfectly restored temples in the archaeological park. Quite a sight to see trees growing among the ruins. It is kind of easy to get lost though. Brings to life how much effort conservation really takes! The absence of people in the temple trying to sell stuff is an added plus!

place of natural beauty. A must visit place in cambodia. You can buy 1 day up to 3days pass to visit all temples. appropriate clothes to wear before entering the temples. you can ask tuk tuk driver for USD25 to tour you around the temples plus the museum. and oh please keep your pass all the time cause guards will check it all the time you come to visit any temple. A lot of tourist are coming LIKE US so please dont forget to bring water cause its very hot inside. By the way please get tuk tuk outside cause the hotel transpo is much more expensive.

Unbelievable Scenery. Our privately hired taxi for our group of 4 with a guide took about 2 hours to arrive from our hotel in central Cambodia. This place is absolutely amazing - like walking through an ancient forest with derelict buildings and temples. Wonderfully well maintained and preserved.

Fabulous despite the crowds taking endless selfies!. Very busy especially with large tour groups of East Asians who often were very loud, made slow progress and took endless photos and selfies, often not of the Temple but more like a fashion shoot. It was the most visually impressive temple for us despite these issues however.

A movie set feel . It's easy to see why they filmed parts of Tomb Raider here I felt a little like Indianna Jones myself. A great spot for photographers but you need a little patience as it is quite busy and lots of people popping into your shots.... Lunch time was best for escaping the crowds. Allow 1 to 3 hours to check out this place properly, was my favourite part of Siem Reap.
Favourite. This was my favorite temple to visit, it is a little less sterile and oozes character. An absolute must.

A leap in time. This place is a leap in time.. Some structures have collapsed & nature has taken an opportunity to fill the space.. How did this happen & why here & not in the other temples is a bit of a Mistery but this is certainly a place worth to visit.

Like being on a movie set. Enchanting temple with all the trees growing thru the ancient ruins, arrived quite late in the afternoon which proved to be the perfect time of the day regards the light for photography purposes.

Impressive tree. There are shops set up all over this temple so you basically have to walk by these little children with sad faces and crazy sales skills to get in. And of course I had to buy a magnet, purse, scarf... etc. Thought about hiring them for my sales staff. They were impressive!

Really beautiful place..... I visited several temples during trip to Siem Reap, buat Ta Phrom for me is the most wonderful. Not only about the temple, the root, the big trees, but also the atmosphere surrounding is amazing.... so peaceful. I visited there twice within 3 days......

It IS gorgeous, but there are now barriers in the way. This temple is lovely - no doubt about that. The strangler figs are a sight to behold. But the best part for me ended up being the details in the carvings and the "easter eggs" hiding here and there (such as the "dinosaur" sculpture). The famous "Tomb Raider" shot as well as the other dramatic parts were not quite as appealing as I expected because there were barriers in the way. Guess that's inevitable if a place gets too much traffic.

Nice adventure, wonderful place!. I was so impressed with this because it's like going to another world. Many big and huge trees growing on to the place . Big and giant roots went through the roof and walls. So many spots for the photographer. Took me about 2 hours in there. You should go there in the morning to avoid the crowded otherwise your pictures will full of other people in them.
Holiday. This temple of trees was so awesome. Quite different to other temples we visited but the tree roots tangled amongst the rock building was amazing.

Wonderful trees growing over the ruins!. This place is special and unique because of all the trees growing up right in the middle of the ruins. Some of the trees a d roots are huge. It is wonderful to be there in person and be a part of this

Stunning. With the trees invading the temple, it really is a unique temple to visit and well worth taking the time to see. The displays on conservation are really interesting also. It is also pretty cool to see where Lara Croft: Tomb Raider was filmed.

Part of the whole Angkor experience. This attracts a lot of Lara Croft fans but is a really great walk around etc, as well as in it. This shows how these building were overtaken by the jungle and only found in the 1800's by a French man in the jungle for a walk.

The most serene of all Ankor's temples. Don't come to the Ankor site without seeing this beauty! Left in a relative state of decay with the jungle both destroying and supporting the temple in equal measure. If you can get here for sunrise, the experience is wonderful!

One of the most visited of the temples. Due to its staring in the movie with Angelina Jolie this temple receives lots of visitors so you might have to queue in order to have a good picture with the main landscape. Its still being restored so you might see constructions works here and there but all very discreet, The combination of nature trying to take over man-made architecture is stunning.
Temple in The Jungle . If you have no much time, you should visit three temple. They are Angkor Wat, Bayon Temple and the last one is Ta Prohm Temple. They are amazing!!

Intriguing. We did not book a guide so we did not have much info about the temples. But Ta Prohm stood out because of the trees of hundreds of age growing around the stones, nature merging with the temple. Ta Prohm is one of the most intriguing temples there.

Crowded but worth the trip! Different than other temples.. This was by far the most crowded of all the temples. It might have been the time that we were there but around 3PM there are always at least 10-30 other people in the same area with you. It can be a little hard to get those really cool photos. That said it was still an amazing experience and had a very different feel than the other temples. I've heard that in Angkor Wat there had been almost constant work through the ages to keep the jungle back, not so here. You just cannot capture the scale of this place in a photo. It does make you feel so small.

My favoriet in Siem Reap. Amongst the well-known temples, Ta Phrom still retains its history of decay by mother nature. It is a history being erased at some of the other temples so you might want to make sure you visit here before UNESCO ruins everything.

Definitely worth a visit. This temple is definitely worth a stop. The trees are amazing as they grow atop the temple areas. It is a fascinating place with so much history. There are usually tour bus groups, so going early is a good plan. Having a guide will be beneficial as there is so much history here. Be sure to purchase a ticket at the center prior to your visit.
You can see what you saw in tomb rider. This is best combination of well restored as well as trees growing on roofs and walls. Very beatiful carvings and good combination trees and temple structures.
Wow. This has to be seen to be believed, so many great photo opportunities, good here even when it is really hot, but don't forget to take plenty of water

Surreal experience. Yet again we were overawed by this temple and the fact that they has left it as it was found with the trees and vegetation growing around and through the building. A very spiritual and awe inspiring experience.

Nature is taking over!. Awesome; this alien trees! Nature is gonna win, that's for sure! Ta Promh is a wonderful tempel, it's worth the trip. You can make great pictures here and think about Indiana Jones too.

unique in so many ways. well, you know it from the films... but seeing Ta prohm in person is special. The only problem is that it is always crowded with loads of tourists.... there is no quiet time- so be prepared

Impressive! . After visiting Angkor Wat, we went to see Ta Prohm. It took us about 15min from Angkor Wat to Ta Prohm with tuk tuk driver. Its beutiful and impressive to see growing out of temples. Most turists go there because Tomb Raider was filmed on that location.

A sight that will capture your senses. A most beautiful sight. Nature taking over human creation. SImply awestruck with this temple and its beauty. Hollow trees and roots galore. The temple itself beautiful

Amazing. Incredible temple. The temple itself is falling down a little more than some of the others, but the trees are amazing. They are growing out of piles of rubble and on top of stone walls. Truly majestic.
Tomb raider temple. This is the famous tomb raider temple featured in the movie it has amazing shots for the photographer in you all to capture

Mind blowing. This temple, used in the Lara Croft Tomb Raider movie was everything we had heard about it and more. The way nature has slowly but surely started to reclaim the space through and around the amazing man made structures is simply incredible. Must see!

Different and amazing. A very different temple to Angkor Wat with the jungle trees taking over the ruins. Great for photography. It also seems cooler to walk through because of the trees. If you had only 2 temples to choice from then this would be the other to Angkor Wat. Highly recommend

Nature Responds with its beauty. A part of the wondrous Siem Reap complex and a must see for all who venture to this wonder of the world. The maze of the temple is intriguing with the touches of nature intertwined.Visit as many temples as you can but definitey see Ta Prohm!

Simply Amazing. I was told a movie was shot here - Tomb raiders. Hence it is very popular among tourist. This place really looks ancient with all the roots growing and enveloping the walls and structures.

Iconic Tomb Raider Temple. This temple, made famous by the film "Laura Croft: Tomb Raider," is truly magnificent, iconic, and Instagram-ready monument and testament to blooming life and forces of nature amidst the ruins of the now extinct Khmer Civilization. Highly recommended!

When nature empowers mankind. This place made me realize that there will be a day when everything on this planet will be destroyed and nature will take over the power. We will be converted into fossils and rocks.
Angkor Thom is the prime example. Around 1100 BC, it was the world's largest inhabited city. Now the sculptures are clinched under the roots.
Interesting temple. Choosing which temples to see is difficult but Ta Prohm is not to be missed. The trees holding up the structure make is a sight to see.

This is the Tomb Raider Temple... But Other Things Are More Interesting. This is the temple where a lot of Tomb Raider was filmed. Apparently that makes it interesting to a lot of people.Therefore, this was one of the more crowded temples we visited. It was beautiful and interesting, but I found the crowds distracting. Within this temple, I did particularly enjoy experiencing a small shrine where you could pound your heart and it would make a really lovely echo in the small room. NOTE: Other temples I visited -- in order of my favorite to least favorite (note… my preference is for a balance between crumbling and in tact and not as crowded but all of these temples are fantastic for different reasons): Preah Khan, Ta Som, Banteay Srei, Ta Prohm (tomb raider), Bayon Temple, Angkor Thom (gates and elephants), Angkor Wat
Amazing temple . This place is not to be missed: I've never seen nature so perfect mingling with a construction. The temple has many inner courts, is a little labirint with magnificent small temples

Different than the others. Ta Prohm is different than the others - make sure to visit! The park is filled with such beauty - I recommend spending 3 days looking at the various temples/wats. I recommend getting a tour guide for at least one of the days so you get more out of the experience.

Absolutely Lovely & Mystical. The trees and architecture are vey surreal. I absolutely loved this temple. Ta Prohm is nestled in the forest and it is an idyllic walk to the temple. It was a very spiritual experience.
amazing. We were very lucky to have a great guide Tom. This place was beautiful with nature and history blended together for an amazing sight xxx

Raide The Ta Prohm. Though fame highly augmented by Angelina Jolie of Tomb Raider movie, Ta Prohm lived up beyond my expectation nevertheless. Nothing comparable to what awe it holds for you. The rumbles might seems like old ruins, yet in the midst of the woods and grandiose trees, you will be kept captivated all trail long. One of the BEST & must-go-to templeRecommendation: Thanks to the massive restoration effort, the path is well laid and you wont get lost through this forsaken city. Yet the path towards the gates can still be confusing. Ascertain which gate you entered through - you might end up exiting on the other side of the complex if you didnt pay enough attention (happened to me huhu)
Favourite temple. You feel like you are in a film set for an Indiana Jones type film. Could have spent a lot longer here.

Centuries Old trees on a Temple. This is part of our trip in Angkor Wat and it is indeed a great sight. Our guide showed us the "chicken feet", big bald trees etc.
The tour was hot and humid but the sight is amazing.
Exceptional legacy . This is the wonderful temple that only one in the world , we can get a lot knowledge related to the history of this temple , our family really enjoy with Ta prom temple ,

Incredible!. This is the temple where part of the movie Lara Croft was filmed. Many of the tree roots have grown into the temple itself making it very surreal. You could be forgiven for thinking some of the grey bricks are polystyrene from the film set!! Believe me they are not. Another one of the many amazing temples in the Angkor complex, not to be missed.
Go there.. Not to be missed; this is what you were thinking of when you decided to see th eAngkor Wat/Siem Reap temples.
Real wonder!!. It pretends to be one of the most amazing places on Earth! Really MUST SEE! It looks like something from another universe... I was impressed like never before.

Ta Prohm Temple. A great tour of great locations with a very knowledgeable guide Mr. Tola. We started at Ta Prohm temple from Tomb Raider fame and then visited Angkor Thom and Angkor Wat. We were given extensive detail on the histories of each temple and allowed free time to wander by ourselves. It was extremely hot and humid on the day of the tour but we were provided with as much water as we could drink. The tour does have many steep steps which was made even more difficult by the humidity. We had an excellent set menu lunch at porcuisine that was included in the tour.

part of a great tour of all temples. all part of a great tour incl Angkor Wat and Bayon templewonderful sights. We arranged via hotel as a private tour . Great photo opportunites and sights not to be missed

Trees trees trees. Wow, the trees growing for hundreds of years out of the ruins make it all even more spectacular . Great that you go in one way, walk through to the other end to meet your transport.So clean and beautiful vegetation all around. Probably my favourite of the three sites visited.

Wild temple. This temple is fascinating. Large trees wrap their roots around the sandstone blocks, trying very hard to take over the temple. Remember to slow down and take your time to stop and sit and soak in your surroundings. If you rush between temples, very soon "temple fatigue" will set in. This temple was a highlight of our trip to Siem Reap.

Ta Prohm was amazing. We visited this fascinating site in the evening so there were not too many people around. The trees and ruins are just phenomenal. Look for hidden statue faces in between wicked tree roots.

Magical place . We booked a guide and did Angkor Thom and Ta Prohm in one day. This is a very magical feeling place. Lots of 'natural' damage to the temples from the spong trees. You can do this place in an hour, longer if you want to linger. We all loved it
Tomb Raider. This is the Tomb Raider Temple site. Great photos to be had. Small but include when going to other temples.

Used as sets in one of the Indiana Jones Movies. The archeologists decided to leave one temple more or less as they found it. Marvel at the extent to which the tree roots have taken over the buildings, look down corridors with piles of stones just where they landed over the hundreds of years. It was used as a set for the Indiana Jones movie, and you can see why. This is the temple I will remember most

Great place. We had not seen Tomb Raider which is apparently where this was filmed. However we got lucky and were there very early morning so had the place pretty much to ourselves and manged to experience the tranquility of this temple complex.Well worth going to see.
Great temple. This complex is amazing to see, it is half temple, half jungle now. It was raining very heaviy on the day we went but that was fine it added a great atmosphere to the place.

The tomb raider temple is amazing. For all the tomb raider fans, this is the temple and its well worth the visit. The sooner the better in the day as the tourists swarm to this very popular attraction. One of the top 3 must see attractions in Siem Reap along with Bayon Temple and Angkor wat. You will not be disappointed.

Nature's owned it !!. One of the most imposing temples and the one which has best merged with the jungle, but not yet to the point of becoming a part of it. Nevertheless, much work has been done to stabilize the ruins (thanks to the Archaeological Survey of India), to permit access, and to maintain "this condition of apparent neglect." Try to reach earlier in the day to beat the crowds and visit it peacefully and get best photo opportunities (like Lara Croft in Tomb raider ). The fact that you see nature can reclaim everything in front of you will make you think deep about life and nature in general. Very introspective visit indeed!

The tomb temple. After I had been to Angkor Wat the tuk tuk dropped me off. I was suppose to be one hour nearly 2 hours later I return. 1 readon is there are 2 entry/exits i came out the wrong one and had to walk all they it again. Totally mind blowing. At parts it is very narrow and with all the tour groups was frstrating. But again at one point I say on a tree stump by myself and took in the amazing temple. Alot has fallen down over time. The trees growing from it incredible. A must go place

Crowded. This is a very popular place to visit due to Tomb Raider film and is known know as the Tomb Raider Temple. It's amazing to see nature in action (what you see here with the trees growing round the temple, you see at a lot of the temples in Cambodia).

Tranquility at it's best. Even though Ta Prohm is #3 on the list of well visited temples in Angkor I find this the most tranquile. Probably because not much restoring has taken place - Nature has more or less taken over.

Must visit!!!!. We visited all of the temples in the Angkor city and this one was by far our favourite. Not only is it the tomb raider cave but when you go through every archway or turn every corner it's just another amazing sight. So stunning with the trees and the roots embedded into the cave you'll want to take hundreds of photos. Go early for the best photo opportunities.

This where the tomb raider movies did some recording. This is a really cool temple and it is a bit more run down but it has a great charm and if you have a good imagination you can envisage how amazing it would of been in its hey day. This has renovation work being carried out too.

Tomb Raider. For me the best of all the Khmer sites here in Siem Reap. It's not just another temple and there's a lot of them. It was left exactly the way it was discovered by the French explorers in the 1800's. Amazing trees growing off of everything...

Amazing, mystical world. This was our favourite Temple visit in Siem Reap. Nestled in the jungle, it was slightly cooler than the other temple sites and much more mysterious and magical due to the massive trees that had taken over the ancient ruins. Nothing else like this in Cambodia!

Early morning visit. Visit this temple between 7-9AM to have a peace of mind in exploring the temple and avoid crowds. The temples give excellent opportunities for clicking awesome pics and would also give a feel as to how the temples looked when they were re-discovered after centuries.
Tomb Raider. This is the temple that featured in Lara Croft Tomb Raider movie.. with strangler figs growing on, over and thru this temple makes it an amazing sight.A must see !!

Very busy but a must see!. This was by far my favourite temple, so atmospheric with nature reclaiming the temples for herself. Sometimes it was difficult to tell where stone ended and tree began. I would recommend making this the first stop on your temple tour - before you get too hot and bothered to appreciate what you are looking at! Take water, take a fan and don't forget your camera!!

A breathtaking mix of nature and historical architecture. This was the filming place for Angelina Jolie's Tomb Raider so that says enough of this temple. The way the trees grow together with the temple ruins make for great pictures and the story behind the temple with the detailed architecture is humbling and enlightening.
Favourite Temple. This is the most popular temple....lots of fabulous photo opportunities here!! This is where the Lara Croft movie was filmed.
Amazing, dazzling views !. Such an enchanting visit at Ta Prohm... with all these trees grown on the roofs of the temples ! Loved it !

Wonderful Taprom Temple.. I went to Ta Prom Temple during my second time visiting Siemreap. This temple is really amazing with the awesome big tree growth above the temple. When you come to visit Siemreap this temple must in your listed place to see.
Brilliant. Much busier than the other temples, so time your visit carefully. It is not as big as the other temples either.

Outstanding Temple. I think this temple might be my favourite. The trees and roots growing through the ruins make for some simply stunning photos... It also has a very nice "feeling" a little more intimate maybe. A must do....

Beautiful Ancient Temple. It is a must to visit when you are in Siem Reap Cambodia. The roots of the huge trees which grows in to the building of the temple. It look like the tree are the protector of the temple.
interesting. bring yourself a local book or a local guide which find your time enjoyable. route up and down at temple make a bit hassle but worth the trip. a lot of interesting and history on walls.

amazing visit. whole family thought this temple was amazing and really enjoyed the trees.. very very hot so remember to take plenty of water and umbrella.. also we did not have a guide so could visit at own pace.. out Tuk tuk driver took us on the Grande circuit and waited for us.. we bought three day ticket so could go back once heat got too much for us.. loved it
Mysterious. One of the main temples in the Angkor Thom. The tree and the buildings are combined together. A must see in Siem Reap
Mesmerising. Absolutely stunning....not just the structure...even flora canopy surrounding this temple is amazing...
It was Amazing temple. Ta Prohm it amazing temple with the big tree covering on the top .it was broken building but still very nice to visiting .

Impressive temple./uin. Part of the small circuit tour. Definitely worth a visit.
Very original with all the tress. Amazing for photos.

Wonderful visit. in the jungle, must walk a little bit and then you enter...totally amazing.Harrison Ford was here, a few years ago, for a movie, Angelina Jolie also. Much more interesting with a guide

Possibly the best temple. Possibly the most interesting temple of our tour due to the massive tree growth and root penetration into the ancient stones. The roots are forced into sculptural forms and are quite beautiful in the juxtaposition of the natural and man-made.
nature reclaiming space. If you are familiar with Tomb Raider the game or the movie,you have seen this temple, but of course is much more magnificent live

Best Temple in the Angkor Wat Complex. If you visit on one temple in the whole of the Angkor Wat complex (ok I guess you should also go see Ankor Wat itself!) then you HAVE to go to Ta Prohm. And not just because Angelina Jolie did a film there! The photography opportunities are abound, we spend hours there! Try to go our of peak times to avoid bus loads of tourists. If you do come across a bus load just slow down or stop, they are pass through pretty quickly!

Fascinating!. Seeing Ta Prohm in person was like another dream come true. To be able to witness a part of history was quite surreal. If you plan on visiting Siem Reap, a must-do is to make coordinate a day to visit the temples. It may be a bit over crowded, as many travelers have the same thing in mind, but it wouldn't be regretted. As I love photography, Ta Prohm and all other temples helped create some awesome photographic memories! It has to be seen with your own eyes. The detailing in the stone with nature intertwined, to the architecture of the temple is truly a work of historic art.

Visit to Ta Prohm temple with incredible tree roots. Remarkable to see the power of nature as trees growing within temple walls have grown so tall and thick and have developed root systems which are literally tearing the temple apart. Surreal.

Tree trunks highlight. I didn't find this place attractive.. There is natural beauty of tree trunks , real thick trunk .. Lot of walking .. Up and down .. Wear sport shoes and carry water .. It's extremely humid there .. This should be the last of the three main temples that one should visit .

Unrestored glory from the past.. Ta Prohm is from late 12th century and is one of the major temples of Jayavarman VII. Actually it's a temple monastery featuring a set of concentric galleries having corner towers and gopuras with other buildings and enclosures. It is also called as Rajavihara, a royal monastery having many Buddhist deities. Consisting of Strangler figs and silk-cotton trees entwined among the ruins, the complex left in it's natural state though it involves lot of work to prevent further damage and continued efforts to clear the vegetation.The trees that have grown among the ruins provide unusual atmosphere as the unrestored state of Ta Prohm with it's size and complex architecture transport us to different world.I entered through eastern gopura and spent almost two hours lost in the majesty of glorious past. It's slippery at couple of places and must watch the steps not to fall.Collapsed buildings, enclosures, shrines, decorative carvings and over grown roots of trees and the double pillored galleried in partially unrestored state provide us the glimpse of how Angkor looked at the time of discovery in 19th century.Not to be missed.

Definitely need to go there. This was a remarkably end of my tour around Angkor Complex. Well-kept natural and historical fantasy. If you watched Tomb Raider so you HAVE to see it yourself. A feeling of mystery. Surprised by how these trees growing up from the ruins. Such great destination in Siem Reap.

What an amazing Temple!. The beauty of this Temple was stunning. The amazing trees that grows around the temple and the hidden smiling carving is the highlight. This temple site is a part of the "small tour circuit" so you can easily visit this in a day with various other temple sites.

Great temple of doom feel. This was one of my favourite temples on the whole site. This one feels wilder and has lots of large trees growing out of the site which add to the Indiana Jones feel - I kept expecting to see snakes slithering around but fortunately didn't!!
A nice change of view. Not far away from Angkor Wat, Ta Prohm has its rather subtle charm. One of striking features here is the must unlikely tree spot

People people everywhere. Does the title say it all - go early, as early as possible with a guide as once the people come it is almost impossible to see the temple for all the selfie sticks and gangsta posers trying to get their pictures
Impressive. Ta Prohm is impressive and the massive trees that have grown over the ruins give it a unique and impressive feel. It was fairly crowded when we visited.

The Tomb Raider temple. This is the infamous tomb raider temple were Angelina Jolie shot her movie, but even if you are not a die hard fan to see how large tree roots interdigitate between the temple walls is spectacular. a must see when you visit Angkor Wat.

Quiet different than other Temples... its cravings and nature of the temple is quiet different than other temples, mostly cravings are not clear but the trees growing over the stones is so beautiful, the temple is mostly dark even if you visit in the middle of the day, perfect spot for pictures.. mostly crowded so try to visit early in the morning for less crowds and some nice pictures..
beautiful and mystic. despite the crowd still one of the most romantic temples. amazing trees entwined with the stones and slowly destroying the temple.

Absolutely Amazing!. We spent 5 days in Seam Reap and toured every one of the locations logged a lot of miles. It was worth every step and this was my favorite of all. The massive trees just set a totally different look to the structures. But be sure with all of these especially Angkor Wat to wear long pants or shorts to knees and shoulders have to be covered for men and women. It is a religious site so there is a dress code to enter some places. Just an FYI

Simply Stunning!. My absolute favourite temple. Despite the crowds (there's no getting away from them), Ta Prohm was almost other-worldy. Very beautiful and peaceful... Great for photo ops; and really a highlight among all the temples. The trees are amazing. A definite must do/must see!
as cool as it seems on tomb raider. Was expecting that there was only one overgrown tree for us to take a picture of, but it turned out to be so much bigger and larger. truly a must see in siem reap

Search for a Dinosaur Carving here. Went here to search for a Dinosaur carving and found it. Tomb Raider picturesque.
But too many tourists!

Jungle temple among hundred temples in Siem Reap. One of the famous temple in Angkor Wat temple complex. Hundred years temples surrounded by huge jungles and it look like these old trees are protecting the temple structures.
Angelina Jolie first movie in Cambodia was taken in this temple too "Tom Raider" one the famous Hollywood movie.

Must have. There's a place where Angelina Jolie has played in "Tomb Raider" but I don't care lol.
Got cambodian root and to be there was amazing.
Magical place to visit. It's a amazing and magical place to visit, with enormous trees which have overgrown the temple. It's known as the Tomb Raider temple and it's a must when you are in Siem Reap.

This site is amazing with the overgrowth of old trees. One of the best temples to explore in the whole complex. Ta Prohm is truly magical with a mixture of restored areas and parts taken over by nature with tree roots growing through walls and towers. Simply amazing place.

Our favorite temple-quiet and peaceful. This was our favorite temple on our tour. Our guide brought us there first right after buying our day passes. The setting is beautiful, located in a forest, so there's also many (for me as a German) stunningly high trees with enormous trunks to see while you walk around plus there's more shade than you'll find at Angkor or Bayom. The way the trees grow 'into' the ruines and win their space back is fascinating. As we were there around 8-8.30 in the morning, there were only few people there, so the atmosphere was very quiet and peaceful and we had the chance to take many great photos without feeling rushed by somebody waiting behind.Of course, if you are more into spectacular views, either by climbing the temples or by the sight of an impressive temple itself, then Angkor or Bayom are the right places to go.

Trees and indiana Jones Feeling. The special thing about Ta Proem it's is impressive trees who have grown over that temple for 300 years. It's amazing and beneath Bayan and Angkor a must if you are around.Take a tour gide , its worth it for 26$ half day, 50$ incl, Minibus

Tomb Raider!. The Ta Prohm is well known for being in the Tomb Raider film. It's very popular (and a bit crowded) for that reason. Makes sure you get a snap of the doorway from the film, but explore the rest of the ruins too! It's pretty amazing with all the trees and roots taking over the temple.

The Earlier the Better . This is a truly mysterious place but to see it at its best (even "out of season") get there for the opening of the gates at 7.30am- there will just be a cluster of people there and you soon all spread out through the whole magnificent complex. By midday, forget it. The hordes rushing round the main circuit will be piling in to keep you company and you would be better off at home watching Tomb Raider.

Ta Prohm. Wow!
A must see when you are visiting Angkor Wat.
Spectacular tree formations. I want one in my back yard😊

Wow!. A magical place to visit. The enormous trees grow in, on and through this temple giving it an Indiana Jones/Tomb Raider vibe.Visit here as early as you can to avoid the heat and crowds. It opens at 7.30am.This temple has a completely different atmosphere to the others, so if you're just visiting 2 or 3 sites in this area, make this one of them.

Iconic trees in ruins. Tourist guides refer to it as the Tomb Raider temple (it features in the first film) but the temple is overgrown everywhere with huge trees with massive roots. You can check out photo's on google images or tripadvisor, but it is every bit as cool as you would expect. It's very crowded and at some places you need to queue to get the picture you want but overall a great experience. It takes you about 60 mins to see everything at this temple.
Tomb Raider site. Amazing ancient tree that has survived over the years on top of a rock. This is the site of the movie Tomb Raider in the tree roots area.

Go early in the Morning. Watch the sunrise at Angkor Wat and then leave straight away for Ta Prohm. By doing this you are the only ones at the temple. You are able to wander at your leisure and take loads of photos instead of having to wait for people to move out of the way. Most amazing temple. Once you have finished here, go back to the hotel for breakfast and then come out again.

Unbelievably crowded. Beautiful ruins. Can imagine the awe of the French explorers when they 'discovered' this in the 1860s. Probably because of its 'Temple of Doom' fame, this temple was overrun with visitors. Probably best to visit early morning to try to escape the crowds.

Personal Favorite. For our group, this was the best temple to see. The trees and carvings make it an ideal place for photos. We kept saying how much the place seemed surreal. Disney could not design a more magical place. It is proof that reality is better than fiction.

Magical Experience. Even after spending several hours at Angkor Wat, Ta Prohm will just blow you away! Feeling like Indiana Jones, we meandered through lichen and tree covered rubble of ancient temples consumed by the jungle. You really get a sense of what the European archaeologists would have seen on their discovery. I also enjoyed seeing the before and after images of the restoration work dome on Ta Prohm by the Indian government.

Tomb raider temple. This is the temple which Hollywood shot a scene for tomb raider. It's a beautiful temple - partially reclaimed by the jungle. It's part of the small temple circuit. My guide was wise. We did this temple first. Typically the temple circuit begins at Angkor Wat. So it was cool -ish and quiet. I sat quietly and almost solo for a while contemplating its ancient-ness -It's covered in the temple pass. I got the 3 day pass for $40 US. I did the small circuit one day. The big the second day. Then I took a day off and did the small circuit again including the sunrise at Angkor Wat. Stay hydrated
My favourite. This was my favourite temple. The trees and nature around it are just stunning and the branches from all the trees wrapping around the temples is so perfect.

Best temple. In the angkor wat complex there are loads of temples. However this is my favourite due to all the trees growing through the temple and the large restoration efforts. This is by far the most beautiful temple and there's a lot of the temple still to see (even though it is a ruin)
Great place to visit. Put it in your first itinerary since this temple was wonderful enough to take my heart. The architecture is fabulous surrounding by the big jungle and stone.

One of my favourites - Ta Prohm. This was an awesome temple. Very busy with visitors, but if you take the time to wander you will see a temple that is well preserved and offers amazing pictures. The interaction of the Bayon trees and the temple is intriguing. Look up to see the honey hives, and the corners offer great photos to be taken.

Famous for a reason . Movie famous temple where nature partially took over making spectacular mix of stones and trees.
Certain places require queuing in order to take a photo due to a large crowds, but it's worth it. Definitely must see place around Angkor temple complex.
Ta Prohm was my favorite!. Don't miss the smaller temple when touring the Angkor Wat area! These temples are so interesting and not as many people.

"Unexpected treasure". We'd visited Angkor wat and Angkor thom earlier, both of which are fantastic, and then went to To Prohm last. I wasn't impressed by all the Tomb Raider stuff or the AJ hype, but this site turned out to be the most enjoyable one of all the ancient sites we'd visited!Hard to describe, but it had everything. Carvings, exotic entries, rocks and stone works, dark passages.I couldn't get over how nature was trying to retake the place. The trees (large an small), growing over the wall and roots going on the walls, through them and around the rocks. They looked like sinister giant snakes and reptilesThe Indian government is also doing a lot of restoration work there....which should make this site even more interesting in the future
Wonderful. Amazing how the trees have grown and it gives you a small sense of what the entire Angkor temple area may have been like when it was left to ruin many centuries ago.
breath taking. amazed to see the giant tress grown over the temple structures/ one must walk little more to go around and see all the important structures /
Best one in siem reap. Go early to beat the crowd. Lovely place. Trees growing everywhere makes it very unique. Liked this better than the crowded ankor wat. Give enough time here.

Tomb Raider tastic . Love this film, but sadly no Angelina was there today. Atmospheric and creepy at the same time, pics with the tomb raider door are a must, but also look out for the dinosaur carving. Several different theories have been advanced to explain its presence. Some maintain it's a recently-carved hoax, while others say that the ancient Khmers could have unearthed a fossil and figured out what kind of creature it belonged to. One theory has it that the image actually shows a cow or rhino with a palm tree in the background - the palm's fronds being easily mistaken for the fin-like blades running down a stegasaurus' back.Or maybe the carving is evidence that dinosaurs really did live on until much later than previously thought. (Creationists would certainly like to believe so.) Perhaps here in the humid, ancient jungles of Southeast Asia, where the climate has remained largely unchanged since the dinosaurs' days, giant reptiles lived on well into the human era - long enough to persist in the Khmer folk-memory. If only these walls could talk, we might have a clue.

What a Place!. I'm so amaze with those big trees that divides the temple... :0 Wooow... A must see place if your traveling to Cambodia just beware of the bees. There are a lot of beehives on top of those big trees. Cheers!

Best of the temples.. The tomb raider temple was an amazing trip. I found this the best of the temples that I saw. The feel and sight of the massive tree roots inject themselves into the experience. I would strongly recommend visiting this particular temple.
Tomb Raider temple:). If i only could visit two locations in Siem Reap this temple and Ankor Wat would be my choice.. Stunning how the vegetation takes over. This site has not been "renovated".

My favourite place overall!. When I first watched the movie of Lara Croft many years ago, I decided that one day I would visit Cambodia and the temples of Angkor Wat. Actually being in Cambodia was amazing. I loved the people, food and of course, the temples. Overall I liked Ta Prohm the best, as it is the Lara Croft temple and the atmosphere is amazing. I would definitely recommend visiting Cambodia and Ta Prohm!

Jungle takeover. My favourite temple! It was so tranquil taking the outside route, surrounded by jungle. Inside was a bit crowded, but we arrived with a few tour buses, so it would probably have been better at a different time. It was absolutely amazing to see how massive trees can take over a majestic temple like that. Beautiful experience.

You'll Be Amazed. Just Don't Expect an Angkor Wat Kind of Temple.. Built in 12th century, this temple was abandoned for 400 years, from the fall of Khmer Kingdom in 17th century until its restoration in 21st century (which still continue). It was decided to keep the temple largely the way it was found i.e. merged with the jungle. That's what makes this temple unique and attracts crowd (plus of course the 2001 Angelina Jolie's Tomb Rider movie). We could see ancient trees soaring high out of ruins and their giant roots crawling over the ground and moss-covered structures. Kind of eerie. The boarded walkways allowed us to explore the complex. If you like Ta Phrom and want to see a much more rustic and less crowded one, go to Boeng Mealea (separate reviews). While in Siem Reap for 3 days, we did not join a tour or hire a guide, instead (as recommended by a TA fellow) used a friendly, knowledgeable young driver named Sochet Ny (+855 12 311 644, nysochectra@gmail.com or search his website driveangkor.com). Sochet took us in his sedan car or nice tuk tuk including picking up from and sending us back to the airport. A great, great experience (visited in Oct. a few years back).

Favorite of all tempels . This was one of the first tempels we visited. It was a huge experience. We were not used to the warmth yet and at some points it got to be very busy. But when we found a was to avoid the crowd it was a great great experience. I would recommend to go early so it's not so busy.
Amazing. Amazing amazing amazing and amazing experience. I am overwhelmed with this place! It's a must see place and the serenity is great and you can feel it.
Temples and trees..... Tombraider!. Some stunning views here with the trees growing into and through the buildings, gives a very natural feel and a great temple to visit when in Siem Reap

My Favourite Temple. This is the temple that I like the most. I really appreciate that it has been left largely untouched. The way the trees have grown over and around the building is fantastic. Take place for taking photos and exploring the beauty of the place. A must visit.

Wonderful merge of nature vs temple. This is the only temple which the trees has merged with the temple. This place was also used for the tomb raider movie. There are a number of stops for panoramic stops and do prepare to queue up. The place is nicely kept and is definitely a must to visit if you are in Siam Reap.
My favourite temple in Cambodia. The way the roots have grown through the temple is mind blowing, and their sheer size is incredible. The best temple we saw by far.
Wow.. One of my favorite places to visit in the area. The way the trees grow through the temples are both awesome and sad to see. True bucket list site.

Great ruins but a bit too commercial. It probably would have left a better impression on me if it was our first visit of the day and not so crowded. Everyone seemed to be rushing to the spot where the Tombraider movie was shot as if expecting to see Angelina Jolie. One does get to see the intense amount of work it takes to get the rubble reconstructed!

The Humongous Roots. I could have taken more photos. The place was kinda crowded when we went there and it was raining but nevertheless I was astonished with those century old trees. I wanna go back to this place.
fantastic place. I am a big tomb raider fan so this place was fantastic for me. Amazing structures where nature and temples combine.

Make sure you visit Ta Prohm when you're in Siem Reap. This was our first temple in Siem Reap and we were deeply impressed. The jungle was the main destructive force to the temples, the growing roots gave the temple a unique character. Wonderful and worth visiting.

Unique temple. Ta Prohm is unique in that it shows how the jungle has overrun human construction. Unfortunately now called tomb raider or Angelina Jolie temple nowadays because of the movie, if you get there early you'll find plenty of majestic and fairly uncrowded shots of giant trees slowly destroying walls and buildings. A must do in Siem reap!

Breathtaking. Ta Prohm, "Great City", is contained within four walls of approx 2 miles each in length.As with the Bayon temple contained within its walls the site is an absolute must - see other posts for further details.

My Favorite Temple. This temple is unique. Must be seen and experienced. It is like being on a sci fi movie set. Worth the walk to the temple. Bring a camera! Not easy to navigate the stones and uneven ground....take your time. Lots of tourists especially when a tour group arrives. Let them pass and take in the wonder of nature doing its job.

Definitely worth a visit. This was the kids favourite temple and they were pretty templed out by then. Make sure you explore all the little areas and not just rush through, kids enjoyed climbing around on the ruins where possible.

Lovely temple. we had the luck that we visited this temple before the busses with big groups arrived. the temple was really nice and the trees growing in between were very impressive. We had a very good guide, who knew very much about the place.
Visiting this place with a guide is definitely worth it.
Never seen before. Well the setting and the way the temple has been restored, speaks volumes of the work put in. The trees and their roots and the jungle all around....uff

lovely temple but very crowded. this was the most crowded of all the temples I visited, the tour guide said this is because of the tomb raider movie, so this was the one I least enjoyed since there were so many other people, besides that it's beautiful, specially some of the towers in the middle are magnificent, I was in awe of the beauty of them, it is also the one covered in tree roots and this made it very special.
like the movie. is amazing what the nature can do, this is the temple that the movie tom raider 1 was film, is really pretty

Over grown temple really fires the imagination. I loved this temple with it's slightly overgrown feel giving it a more authentic feel. You would be a fool to miss it. If you have a choice, get here for sunrise so you don't have to share it with many others and get the real tomb raider feeling.

One of the most beautiful temples in the world. I liked Ta prohm more than angkor wat. We were there in low season so it wasn't to crowded, and we could explore freely. It really is something special to see how temples connected with jungle. Must see if in Siem Reap
Favourite Temple. As much as I enjoyed seeing Angkor Wat and Bayon, Ta Prohm was definitely my favourite temple. I love that nature has tried to take over. A photographers delight!
Stunning. To me this temple was even more intriguing than Angkor Wat. The rainforest trees are majestic and their roots hold some of the ancient walls together. Wonderful photos can be taken there.
Must see!. Amazing, how nature is taking back what is her's. But maaybe more amazing is the resestance of the temple to bow for mother nature.
Nature Taking Over. It is an amazing structure, but the trees growing into, on top of and across the walls is unique. It shows that over time, nature can grow anywhere...

Rather spend more time in Angkor Wat. The temple was a bit lacklustre compared to others in the area, specifically Angkor Wat. The place was also swarmed by fans of the tomb raider film shouting about it. Quite fitting that both the temple and the film were a disappointment.

A definite must-do when visiting. Possibly the most famous of the temples for Lara Croft fans, this place is certainly a bit different to the main temples with its tree roots draped over it.Sadly on my latest visit, large parts were temporarily closed off while work was being done. A shame as I was alone on my first visit and was keen to show my wife my favourite spots.
Nice ta Prohm. Ta Prohm temple was nice temple with the big tree covering on the top temple also don't forget visiting this temple it Tohm rider place .
Great tree temple. TA prom temple is another temple hide in jangle forest.Ta Prohm is perfect place to visit if you looking for cool relax after trip whole day around Angkor Wat.

Nature vrs. architecture heritage. What sets it apart from the other temples in this huge campus is how the trees have grown withing the rocks and bricks of the temple. The temple appears to be scheduled for restoration. Some areas you can't access, but what you can are amazing enough to enjoy and ponder upon.

100-years old trees growing on man made buildings. Ta Prohm is one of the best examples to show exactly how old these Cambodian temple cities really are. Ta Prohm hosts sites where 100-years old trees literally grow on top of the man-made infrastructure.
Tomb Raider Movie. It is OK and if you are in Siem Reap it will be another temple to visit. The attraction to it is its feature in Tomb Raider movie.

My favorite attraction around Siem Reap. Ta Prohm was amazing. They have not removed some of the trees that have naturally grown into and through the temple. The way the temple and trees have become one is great.

Wow - fascination. This was really the highlight of the region. Smaller, yet far more fascinating than the large temples. The trees have taken over the campus and they are as equally spectacular as the man-made surroundings they have survived.
Magic place. This temple is still being repaired but you can visited and be involved in the roots. It is very big and have a few old and tall trees.
Amazing. Absolutely the most beautiful temple in Cambodia! A must see for everyone. If you go there in April do not forget a hat and a lot of water!!

Pictures do not do justice to the place. IT was unbelievable. Being a nature lover..trees in particular.. I was mesmerised by the Speunk Trees. I am so glad that our Indian Governmentt is aiding in restoring the beauty of the temple where the roof has all but caved in. Would love to revisit the place.

Tomb Raider Movie!. This is the place where a movie call Tomb Raider shooting. According to tour guide this is the No.2 attraction place to visit in Cambodia!As picture you can see there a trees grow in between the ancient building. That's because last time bird eating fruit and shitting around there, so the seeds slowly grow up until what scene we see today.We can see lots of statue, and one of the smiling wall which is natural forming up.It's approximately take you one hour to finish the tour here.Enjoy your tour here if you like to see ancient statue! They are cool!
Just magic. Better than I could ever have expected. Really a magical experience. Go early to avoid the heat and crowds. I cannot describe Ta Prohm you are just going to have to go there :)

Worth a short visit.. Ok so it's the tomb raider temple! I was so looking forward to seeing this jungle temple. Especially the more famous bit of the tree growing through the temple. Well it's certainly a sight to experience. Overall I would say it's a very small peaceful temple and really takes no time at all to walk through. Probably without its famous claim to fame (which in all fairness they do not play on) it's a little underwhelming. Again wear good walking shoes, take water and go early in the morning before the crowds.

Nature be awesome. The trees and general vegetation that have been left makes this place very special. Best time to go is probably at half 7 when it opens as there are fewer people. The place has a curious atmosphere and is amazing to think that this is what the rest of the temples looked like when first discovered, felt more beautiful and natural. Hands down one of my most favourite spots (along with the lake which isn't too far from here)

By far the most interesting of the three main temples. We visited Ta Prohm as part of the short tour of the Ankor Park Temples. I found this one by far the most interesting. The size of the trees and root formations straddling the temple walls is amazing. One struggles yo understand why the temples went undiscovered for so long.

The fence ruins it...but. when something becomes hugely popular, it really needs to be protected from disrespectful people who feel the need to climb or ruin it. We got here at 2pm, but I would suggest late afternoon would be much better with light. Goodluck trying to get a photo with noone else in it!
Temple with the Trees! Gorgeous. You must visit this site! ABSOLUTELY STUNNING! No words can describe the scenery. If you plan to visit Siem Reap, this is a must visit site after Angkor Wat.
Speechless. It's very hard to write an review for Ta Prohm. I've been dreaming to go there, knowing I'd be emotional when I am physically there and I was. The astonishment completely took over me.
Temple . Best temple for being unusual plus famous by Tomb Raider the film - we got there at 7am Glad we did as no one else about, as we were leaving the traffic coming in was chocker.

One of the top temple choices to visit in SR. Well renovated gallery on the outer side of the temple (east side). The trees inside and outside the temple are one of its special features. For places where Lara Croft was filmed, you really have to wait for you to have a personal photo of it. We visited twice and the from 1-3PM was quite crowded. We visited again at around 4-5PM and there were less people and it was easy to get pictures of the placce without a crowd.If you love trees and temples, try to see Preah Kahn as well. :-)

Stunning fusion of nature and antiquity. Ta Prohm was the second of three temples we visited in one day .. supported by local guide Thom. Amazing experience to see the trees and their roots fused with the ancient temple. Although it is much smaller than Ankhor Wat, we liked it better in a way .. the grandeur of the trees and the temple together ... and amazing to see so many of the apsaras perfectly preserved among the tree roots .. Beautiful place..

Probably the most beautiful Angkor site. Ta Prohm is in my opinion the nicest temple at the whole Angkor site. Not so many other tourists and wonderful picture spots. Very famous for the trees growing "out" of the temple...
Those trees!. This temple is beautiful but can get VERY crowded. I would say it's definitely worth a visit - those trees are sensational!
Magical. Amazing how the surrounding landscape is blending with the structures! How these structures were built is mind blowing as well as the carvings that cover so many of the surfaces.

Wonderful jungle experience . An absolute must when in Siem Reap. From a small building with a tree routed through it, the site opens up as a maze of buildings and jungle, all intertwined with each other. Take a camera and take the time to explore and take in this wonderful site.

#1 temple in the Angkor Wat temple area. Be sure to plan more than 1 hour to fully explore this temple. I would recommend saving this one for last since it is the most impressive (making all others seem smaller and less impressive). Be sure to carry a bottle of water with you everywhere and have $1 bills for souvenirs.

Where is King Louis. This is an incredible temple. The way nature has retaken possession is awe inspiring, and gives a glimts of hope that mother earth will make it/survive us, even in this time of global warming. The only thing missing is King Louis putting on a dance in the central courtyard. The temple is probaply not so architecturally interesting as many of the other temples at Angkor Wat, as much of it has been destroyed by nature and time, but the magic is very much alive here. If you take the "small tour", at the day when you see the sunrise over Angkor Wat, I would suggest that you take the tour anti cluckwise, and start with Ta Prohm, as you would the avoid to see all the temples together with the busloads of Chinese an Japanese, who are also flocking to this incredible venue.
Amazing!. My personal favorite of the temple complex. Its also an oasis from the hot sun as its well shaded with trees.

Top of the cutve. Not easy to make long story short.....but, run!!! The place is full of magic, like a voice from the past who is still with us
Top for all ages. We came 4 of us and got a top visit.

A wonderful reminder that trees live very long. Apart from being the site for Tomb Raider scenes, this amazing monument that was built by Jayavarman VII as a tribute to his mother is a must-visit. It's not very far from Angkor Thom and is one of the 3 main sites when in Angkor Archaeological Park. You'll have to jostle with other tourists for the best photo views but it is all worth it. The restoration work is still ongoing but is very nicely done. Having a trusty guide can be helpful. There are two routes - one that goes out the way you go in (east gate), and there is one that goes out through the side and to the west gate. Signs are not too clear so you may need to ask someone.
Mesmerising. Doesn,t Matter if you have seen Tomb Raider or not.. boy you have got to see this temple almost engulfed by the trees.

What we expected and more. When I read that this place was used in the making of the Tomb Raider movie, I knew I had to visit. The views around Ta Prohm were just facinating. one cannot believe the way those trees have grown through the years through the structure. Much has been been done to restore the temple, but one wonders what will become of this archaeological site in the next hundred years. I was glad I was able to see this. Very helpful staff to direct you to the various points(if you know what to look for so that you can get around faster) Just beware they might be looking for a quick buck especially when they start offering to take pics for you. Spectacular!!.
Beautiful!. By far the coolest temple I've ever seen. Some temples get a little same same after a while, but this one is unique and absolutely stunning. A must!!

Ta Prohm wow.
