My favourite temple. Every fan of Tomb Raider will recognise this amazing temple with all the fig trees growing dramatically out of the remains. It's more sheltered by trees than the other main temples such as Angkor Wat and therefore felt more comfortable to tour in the hot season. A definite must!

Nature wonder but avoid peak time visits. Ta Prohm leaves you with eyes and mouth wide open. You see the huge trees with their various shapes, how they embrace walls and rocks It is simply amazing and jungle-like! And of course let's not forget that most people visit it because of the Lara Croft: Tomb Raider movie. TIP: Try to visit early, when we went it was too crowded and too heated we couldn't really enjoy it as much as we want! Some people recommend you see it at dawn when there is a breeze and the whole place seems different and more impressive. To conclude, Ta Prohm should be High on your list!

Amazing. Worth every second. So much history and incredible how nature has worked within this temple. Worth having a guide. Ours - Mr Sim Kimhour - was an absolute gem of a man for our two days touring. Thanks to him we have many many stories to bring home.
Old Trees. Lovely and well maintained archeological site. Seek it now as some of the trees are getting old and when they are removed for public safety, the site will be no longer the same.

Another amazing temple. It was interesting to see the temples that were featured in movies and to see how the trees have grown over the stone work! Hopefully the many visitors don't ruin the temples and it is good to see funding is being provided to enable restoration works
STUNNING. We visited this temple late in the afternoon - once again scorchingly hot - but stunning - golden/coppery light made this site simply stunning!

Tomb raiders. The jungle taking over the temples and as depicted in the movie!!
This is a must see but every guide is in love with Angelina [Jolie] and that's what you will hear about all the time... Same word for all the area - AWESOME!!

Tomb Raider Temple. This is one of many temples in Siem Reap but definitely not to be missed. I would have liked to spend more time there but we were part of a tour group. If possible I think its best to go on your own using one of the local drivers so you can spend as long as you want .
So many treasures to see. A must to experience. Just as impressive as other ruins but so distinctive as tree roots are supporting the structure

Grotesquely beautiful. Truly amazing.. What an amazing place. We visited late in the afternoon and the light really added to the atmosphere. The screeching sounds from the parakeets along with the buzzing sounds from the suspended bees nests high up in the trees gave it all a prehistoric feel. The tree roots reminded me of gigantic octopus legs. Magical, eerie and grotesquely beautiful. One of my all time favourite places.
Lara Croft land. The trees, the sculpture the sheer sense of history, truly another World class site for your eyes to feats on

Most amazing trees. With this temple you can see how long ago they were built if you look at the growth of the trees. Many know this temple and call it Tomb Raider because that is where they filmed some parts of the movie. Unfortunately a lot of the temple has crumbled so theres more rubble than walls around the outside. However, inside the center of the temple is mainly intact.

The Tomb Raider Temple. Interesting but not quite as stunning as the other temples but still worth the effort. Has the tomb raider tree and some other extraordinary natural effects. It has been left largely as it was found.

Better than the movie.... The Tomb Raider movie does this place no justice but I can understand why it sparks the interest - everything you'd expect and more. The locals even call it the Tomb Raider temple now, so that's the only name you'll need for directions to get there, but this ruin will be just one of many you'll get to throughout the whole ancient ruins complex, just don't miss this one! Take note of the fascinating history of the religious feuds between the Hindus & Buddists, very significant to why the ruins were abondoned. Ta Prohm is one you must see and is not just one temple overgrown by trees, there are plenty in these ruins - another jawdropper of Angkor!
Nice Big tree. Ta Prohm is very nice temple have big cover on there .It was very interesting ,this temple is tohm rider one very popular.

Best complex in the area besides Angkor Wat. Ta Prohm might be a slightly less famous temple in the Angkor area, but it is probably my favorite one. Situated in the jungle, this old temple has been partially overgrown by huge trees, resulting in spectacular sights and an ideal place to take some amazing photos. Make sure to put this temple on your list when visiting Angkor.

Amazing place. It's a relief that this place has been left alone so you have to work and try to figure out for yourself what it must have been like before it became just a glorious ruin. It was reasonably quiet when we came so you could really absorb the atmosphere of the place.

jungle personafied. yes, all the photos you saw are true. there are trees growing out of the temple. take your time to enjoy. we recommend you go with a professional photographer, kimleng sang, a local guide who knows how you can get the best photos.
Good for 10minutes. Interesting to see the trees that have over taken the old temple and that tomb raider was partially filmed here but once again it's pretty boring

Movie set. You have to pinch yourself. This is the real deal, not a Raiders of the Lost Ark or Lara Croft movie set. The buildings are around 700 years old and the trees growing over them 300. Lots of surprises as you walk around. Again a guide is a must just to catch the significance of everything.

Tomb Raider movie was shot here. Incredible trees erupting from the ruins... Amazing, incredible, absolutely must see place! This is one of the more amazing temples in the Angkor complex. A site that everybody should have on their bucket list.
Trees. The best example of reclamation by nature, and accordingly great for photography. Very touristy however

Don't miss out on this one. Perhaps less well know than other temples but an absolute must see experience, Ta Prohm certainly exceeded our expectations. To get the most out of the experience I would highly recommend having a private guide.
Like out of a movie!. For me, this temple beat out Ankor Wat. It's obviously smaller, but the way the jungle has invaded, with huge 300 year old trees growing from the walls is just amazing!

Mind expanding experience . You have to somehow remove yourself from the surroundings of other tourists to tap into the pervading aura of this temple. Unfortunately, human beings have a way of missing the cues, even when in places of such significance. This place transports you to another time, another place altogether. The fact that we could spend time here was in itself, a great privilege. The images speak for themselves. The scale is smaller than Angkor Wat (the City Temple) but it is no less awe inspiring.

Tomb Raider. A must visit place when you're in Siem Reap.
My advise: Booked a tour guide to show you around the temple at the same time explain to you the history of the place.
Wear a good sport shoes. there will be a lot of walking and climbing up / down the steep stairs

It was built in 12th century by the famous King Jayavarvan VII indicated to his mother.. Cycling through the shady road with a little pumping because of the a few pot-holes. There you will begin to see Kravan temple, Banteay Kdei, and stop at the famous Ta Phrom, embraced by the roots of enormous fig trees and gigantic creepers. Visit Ta Phrom (45 minutes-1 hour). It was built in 12th century by the famous King Jayavarvan VII indicated to his mother. While clearing back the forest archaeologists decided to leave the vegetation of Ta Phrom in place to serve as a reminder of how the original discoverers found it and the other Angkor temples. Many of the trees have grown around and through the remains and soar high above the temples. Continue the cycling through small circuit passing Ta Keo temple, Chao Say Tevoda, Tommanon before reaching to Angkor Thom city

Beautiful Ta Prohm. This is one of the most famous temples in Siem Reap. There were several big trees that have roots grew over the temple's walls. Ta Prohm is my favorite temple, alongside with Angkor Wat, Bayon, Preah Khan and Banteay Srei. Went there during the noon when there was only fewer tourist. The temple is big and some of the path is confusing, either you can get lost or you can find a very quiet spot in the temple.Spent like 1-2 hours in this temple. Compared with other temples - the hawkers in this temple are the most persistence in selling their stuff.

Witness the power of nature. After visiting the perfectly preserved Angkor wat temple we went to visit this one and were able to see what would happen if nature was allowed to take over! It was stunning and exciting. A small temple so you don't need a lot of time to walk around it, but it was a memorable experience for us and the kids..

The best of the lot because.... Ta Prohm is the best because of its left-to-it look and feel.Difficult to navigate but around every turn us another fabulous banyan cuddling the temple.Go early, take a tuk tuk, drink lots of water and ignore the vendors.

This temple is a must see but is therefore always very busy. All the temples are amazing, but if I had to choose one, this was my favorite. Trees have grown into the complex both hurting and helping the structure. Bring your camera and bring cold drinking water.

Trees everywhere. My friends and I visit here after skip some temple because of exhausted and starving. We used half day tour from our hotel. Trees all over the temple. Some walls need to be supported with something cause of the roots of trees.
Good visit . This is the temple known by the locals as Tomb raider (referring to the movie) it is located in the middle of the jungle and it is worth the visit.

Unbelievable beautiful. Can't express the beauty of the tample in words. My visit was in april and it was humid and hot but i still enjoyed the place. The huge tree roots that have gripped the tample is a unique site. A must for all those who enjoy history.Watching the sunrise is recommended though i watched the sun rise at Angkor Wat.There was a movie shooting going on and it was hilarious to watch.

This is an amazing national treasure. This location is magical. I could only say that the photos does not do it justice. The amazing trees just seem to mold perfectly with the ancient structures. Every corner is picturesque
A must see temple. The carving on this temple is just great. bring a high resolution camera so that you can treasure the carvings before global warming destroy them.. So pristine.

The Temple shown in Tomb Raider film. It's amazing to see the strong roots of the tress clutching the temple. I am wondering how old are the tress. How long they have stood there to see the history of Ta Prohm temple?
You are captured from the start. If it's not on your bucket list it should be! It is really exciting to see these huge trees climbing on these temple walls. Great Continuation after Angkor Wat.

Breathtaking. It is every bit as wonderful and amazing as you expect it to be. So different. So impressive.
A must visit temple if you are in Siem Reap.
Those Trees. It was absolutely amazing to me to see actual giant trees growing from the roofs and walls of these buildings, it is a site I won't soon forget.
tremendous place. we liked the mix of antics and the strength of nature taking back the contol over the place, A must to visit.

The best one for me. I really liked this one. After visiting few temples they start to look similar.. so coming to ta prohm was really refreshing. Enormous trees on walls .. very impressive. And the ruins lets you think about past civilizations and what caused this..

My Favorite. It's going to be crowded, but for good reason. Just be patient and you should be able to get the tree growing out of temple photos that you want. Unfortunately there are wooden walkways and platforms that have been built (within the last handful of years as far as I can tell) around the more popular areas of the temple so that takes away from the ruggedness a bit and makes it a bit more difficult to get some of the classic shots without obstructions. Still an amazing place to visit though.
Impressive !. Really worth it, the tomb raider temple☺ with all those trees crawling on the ruins. Nature still has its right here. Also quite a few wall sculptures clearly remaining on the walls.

The Tomb Raider Temple. Probably the most packed. Was confused by the layout, but amazed by the effort put to restored the temple. Need to walk to get to the temple. Lots of kids will follow you around asking you to purchase souveniers from them.
Amazing!!!. Really love it. Not to miss. also called the pink temple.was really beautiful. The are still some restoration works goin on.

Yes, this one is a must. Ta Prohm is very large and extensive. It's maybe half restored, which gives you a good idea how it looked 100 years ago, and how much effort is involved is restoration. We are here in hot, dry May 2016, and I'd like to see it when it is wet and cooler. Heat exhausted us by 11AM.
Amazing. To see the roots of the trees extend across the whole temple just blew my mind at how the survival instinct of nature is so strong! Definitely recommended.
Amazing Temple. Ta prohm is amazing temple in siem reap .This temple Tohm Rider one have the big tree cover on the temple i recommend it was very nice

An absolute favourite. I knew I was going to love this temple, to see how the tree roots have embraced the temple and clearly taken over is something else. It is quite simply amazing - the trees themselves are incredible but to see how they have embedded themselves into the stone has to be seen to be believed. I love this temple, would highly recommend visiting it - take a guide to really appreciate what is going on here.

Trees. This was the last temple visit out of all the temple's in siem reep and in was not disappointing. The trees are amazing with their entwining roots and it is easy to see why it has been used for film sets. Worth going to
Great site . A great site with real tomb raider appeal and in our case great hide and seek' with toddlers opportunities. Beautiful, peaceful, mysterious and fun
Top of the Top!!!. From the monkeys swinging in the trees, to the astounding growths of trees and roots. This place is worth a world spanning journey. It is beyond superlatives. Go, go, go.
Stunning Temple!. The intricacies and ornateness of the temple was incredible, something other worldly, I felt like a modern day Indiana Jones walking through the past.

ancient fantastic temple. It is the old temple with big tree cover it,it is fantastic.It is many point to take the picture ,you just to walk around , about 1 hour to see around the temple.I suggest the car rent with driver,he is very good service mind,toyota camry with air conditioner. contact with facebook MSN: vin sing dmk

Enchanting place . Of the temples we visited this is the one which is the most spellbinding. The trees are as amazing as the temple itself.
It is really hot here and be prepared for hordes of vendors with postcards and other trinkets wanting your dollars.

Gigantic Tree Roots overgrowing the temple. My favourite temple amongst all others in the complex.
Well known for its appearance in Lara Croft Tomb raider, this temple didn't fail to enchant us with its natural aura coupled with its civilisation architecture. A change for nature lovers once you get bored of the similar grey blocks of temples.

Too busy to enjoy if you go in the morning during rush hour. So most tours and tourists will follow the general route recommended by hotels etc. You start at Angkor Watt, then go to Bayon, and then head to the tomb raider temple. This means everyone arrives here at the same time. The line to see the big tree in the middle was frustrating. Do yourself a favour and make your itinerary more flexible. Do the general route the other way around. We found out that this temple is almost empty late afternoon after 3pm. Best is to get a guide for a private tour if you do not know the 'rush hours' for temples in the area. It will be way more enjoyable.

Sublime. Not to be missed - one of the main temples. The lack of restoration on this venue is an interesting juxtaposition to some of the others. Don't get lost in the many turns and twists. Can be crowded as it is a top attraction. Not to be missed.

Expectations can be too high. As this is now one of the most famous temples in Angkor, people flock to it with high expectations. I was a little underwhelmed. Though this is beautiful to see and imagine as it was, I found my visits to other temples in the area far more engaging.
Amazing cambodia. Our favourite of the whole complex. Everything we ever hoped - and better. A must see. Cambodia is the most amazing country.

My second favourite in Cambodia. I must admit the fact that the forrest is taking back the temple and incorporating it back into nature is a way of reminding me that when humans have gone the way of the Dodo the forests will return. Nature will recover! A great temple with some remarkable carvings. Look for the dinosaur in the carvings. A triceratops I believe. Now explain how ancient Khmer knew about dinosaurs?

Incredible trees erupting from the ruins. Amazing, incredible, absolutely must see place! A visit to Siem Reap is not complete without seeing Ta Prohm. How has nature enjoyed the passage of time with the ruins is exciting to see!

The Trees~!. The trees in this temple are so cool- it's amazing to see what trees can do. This is probably the most popular temple due to movies and photos, and it was one of the most crowded temples that I went to early on in the day. There was a long wait to get photos with the trees that are overtaking the temple, because there were TONS of tour groups there on top of people just going along by themselves. Get there early to avoid the crowds? Maybe, I think that it would be worth it.

Known as tomb raider tomb, but really...this temple should be appreciated for itself. Unlike most other temples, this temple has lots in-grown trees that seemingly blend with the temple itself. The temple is not as well visited towards the end of the day so I'd try to sneak in couple hours before the closing time. The temple is vast and it is easy to wander around and catch spots without tourists.

Best temple in Angkor complex!. This is the most beautiful temple in the Angkor complex. The ruins are magnificent with gigantic trees growing right on the ruins. Made famous by the Tomb Raider movie.

Incredible visit. Ta Prohm is one of the most important religious monuments in Siem Reap. This archeological site must not be missed. It is impressive and part of the film "Tomb Raider" took place here.

Crumbling in nature. Ta Prohm is where Angelina Jolie was Laura Croft in Tomb Raider. She's hot, and seeing the way nature is coexisting with the temple is amazing to see. There is plenty of debris and rocks to migrate through and you can get some incredible pictures here

The Temple from Tomb Raider. If you have seen the movie Tomb Raider then you should be familiar with this temple. It is a must see. It is still under restoration, but you can still see a significant portion of it. I would definitely get a tour guide. We had a tour guide show us around and it was well worth the money.

Amazing forces of nature. This jungle temple was one temple we were really looking forward to visiting and it didn’t disappoint. The huge roots of the trees seem to be growing out of the structures themselves, making it difficult to see where nature starts and ends. It’s amazing the buildings remain standing with these huge trees sprawling throughout them, even knowing the trunks are hollow, and in fact are now supporting these structures. Really an incredible sight to behold.We spent about 45 minutes here. It’s quite a small site and although interesting we were here around midday and the heat was very intense. We had taken lots of water to drink but in May it was very hot and with the sun out not a lot of shade to take cover under.To visit any of the Angkor Wat temples you need to have an Angkor Pass, available in 1, 3 or 7 day passes. This gives you access to the temples for any of those number of days in a given week, or month if you have a 7 day pass, they don’t have to be used on consecutive days. We went with a 3 day pass for $40. When you go to the main entrance to get your pass your photo is taken and printed on the pass, which you must present on each visit to a temple. We also visited Angkor Wat and Bayon Temple on the same day as they were included in our full day tour, however although it was beneficial going through these sites with the knowledge of a guide, due to the heat and the magnitude of what we were viewing if we could do it again we would leave these sites for a separate visit and take more time with each. We also found that this site didn’t necessarily require a guide and could be self toured.We enjoyed travelling between the temples by tuk tuk, it was a unique way of travel for us and we also appreciated the cool breezes as we travelled.

A true show of the beauty of nature.. What a perfect place to see the resilience and persistence of nature! The beauty of trees and their roots entwined in ancient architectural structures was art in its most natural form. Not only did the history of Ta Prohm tell a story but so do the many the magnificent tree growths. The terrain here was a lot easier to maneuvre than Angkor Wat but it is best to go in the cooler parts of the day, either early morning or quite late in the afternoon, as the heat can be unrelenting and exhausting.

Very cool set of ruins here at Ta Prohm!. Amazing how all the trees are now part of the temple. Yes, I know it was in the Lara Croft movie but this place is incredibly photographic. Make sure you take your time to really take it all in.

Ta Prohm. Another great adventure in and around these amazing temples. The way the trees have grown through the bases of the temples are quite amazing. I bit of a walk into the temple itself but well worth it.
Amazing. All of the temples here leave you speechless. There always seems to be something different and Ta Prohm is no exception though it can get busy!

Scenic View. The most favourite out of everything from our trip! The heartfelt moment when you are realize how tiny you are compare to the temple and the massive tree. This opens up to the scenario of the apocalypse, when mankind is no longer exists, everything will be back to its root, to Mother Nature. An incredible walk through this temple, some walls are sadly collapse due to a number of reason (trees keep growing, man destruction, materials rotting etc.) so I reckon if visiting the Angkor is in your bucket list, do push to make it happens ASAP.
Awesome. An amazing place to visit. Well worth visiting. A must to see and enjoy. Great to see how they are up keeping the place

Amazing.. The most beautiful temple. Combination of building and huge trees. Although the reconstruction efforts It want last much much long in this condition.We went to see it twice. The second day was raining so it was very cool and nice. If you don't have enough time better take a tour guide. if you don't mind to get lost inside (so fun) you can go by your own. No need more than 2 hr.

Trust people even the rules. I'm quite worry about what happen to me last time I visited the temple Ta Prohm I best friend got sick and unfurtable she has to leave. But she had with my ticket. I explained to the guard that my friend left and the hotel taxi will come back in one hour. Show them the pictures even in my phone that it was taken the day I visit. Tray to make then understand that is about time. Even that entry at west side is not at the beginning. I Several times made my efforts to convince to allows me to get in side and then at the time the Chofer will show up I will provide the ticket they didn't accept me to get in side I waste 1 hour of my precious time. Thanks God chofer came back with my ticket and told them to trust people even the rules. They understand but did not allows me to get in. I suggest to improve the way they check to get in side the temples.

Incredible melt between man labour and nature strenght.. One of the best temples os angkor complex. Angelina Jolie shot scenes of lara croft's Tomb raider right at that location. This temple is very impressive because of the (un) harmonious mixture between a construction done from the man's hands that was taken by nature and by the forest. The enormous trees literally invaded the construction, taking all the available and unavailable spaces. Curious to realize that today the same trees are now helping the temple to stay preserved and free of new landslips. It is one of the most picturesque "tree temple" in angkor. Dont miss it under any circumnstance!

Amazing! Honeymoon trip.. We visited as part of our honeymoon and it is breathtaking. There are a lot of travel blogs with recommendations, but the basics are:1. Dress accordingly for hot weather and respectful for the temples.2. Bring cash for bottled water, you will be buying more than one!3. Be prepared to sweat!

MY FAVORITE OF ALL. Ta Prohm is the BEST of ALL! Everywhere you look, where is another amazing site to take in: the dinosaur carving, the Apsara in the root, the famous sites where Tomb Raider was filmed and AMAZING towering trees, that are breath taking.

Let down. . This was the temple I was looking forward to (everybody loves tomb raider) it just didn't live up to expectations. The others are far better and more beautiful. A lot has been re made here.

Amazing temple. Here, you are there! Angkor temples await you and you will leave happy and impressed ... Of course just for the fact that the Tomb Raider movie was shot there makes this site a place to see, but this temple that french researchers almost left in the state when discovered, is offered to us by a wide path in the jungle and we did see a residence of the mother of King Jayavarman VII built in 1186! It is fabulous

Look what the temple look like before major repaire. This temple was intentionally kept in the status before major restoration. Only those hazards which endanger the safety of visitors and buildings are removed. Temple style was a bit unique with a flat layout, instead of vertical. Good for a visit.
Wow. The juxtaposition between nature and man is incredible. The sheer power of the trees wrapping their way around the buildings is unreal.

Ta Prohm takes you back. Ta Prohm is supposedly an example of the state the Temples were in before they began restoring them, and my god is this one beautiful. The relationship between built being taken back by nature is just charming.

Otherworldy. This is one of the most amazing places you could ever explore. The trees sprouting up through the temple walls are absolutely breathtaking. If you've ever dreamed of feeling like Indiana Jones or Lara Croft, this is the spot!

Amazing roots growing out and over these ruins. This is quite the interesting temple with extraordinary root systems from very large trees overgrown throughout this temple. Angelina Jolie filmed Temple of Doom here and you will see why. Its so unique. More shaded then others and also fantastic!

Awesome place. The movie Tomb Raider was filmed here and this place is just saw awesome in a spiritual and historical sense. The rich history was explained and narrated by our fantastic tour guide Sophea from the Happy Angkor Tour company. Would love to go back and do a repeat soon.

Tomb-Raider Temple!!!. This temple supposedly gives a good indication of what the entire complex looked like when it was "re-discovered" in the 18th century. Massive fig trees have gone wild here and appear to be mother natures minions claiming back the land!
Like something out of an Indiana Jones movie its a must see!
Nice place. The place is nice for photo shooting. The weather is hot but it's better if compare with angkor wat.

Second visit, still feel amazed. Visit the temple for the second time. Arrived at the gate at 6am but the temple open at 7.30. Have one and a half hour exploring nearby village. The temple itself a bit different from my first visit on 2011. There is construction happening. It seems they remove some tree to preserve the temple construction. A bit disappointing but sure it needs to be done. So for the next few years, it would be different. And i prefer visit on rainy season (first visit) the weather much cooler and more greenery. At this time of year, temperature can rise up to 40 degree celsius. It's really hot.
Excellent Visit. This temple is in easy reach of Siem Reap and is well worth a visit. My wife Penny and myself thoroughly enjoyed the tour.

Stunning temple famous from the 'Tomb Raider' films. The photographs of Ta Prohm cannot prepare you for your visit, everything is on a much grander scale that you could imagine. The temple was discovered having been overgrown by the jungle and many of the trees still remain, not least in part due to the fact that they are holding the building together. Ta Prohm was built in the 12/13th Centuries and is a utterly amazing feat of engineering. Beautifully carved and decorated this site is a must visit if in the Siem Reap area. There are many hidden gems such as faces peaking out between the tree roots, so if you have the money it is worth getting a tour guide as they know all the secrets. Either way Ta Prohm makes for a sensational visit, and allows for excellent photographic opportunities.Take lots of water and wipes, temperatures here get very high. This temple is famous from being in the Tomb Raider film.

jungle temple. A temple which Mother Nature tells you who is the boss. Very special. less crowded than Angkor Wat. more shady places than angkor wat. try to visit this temple in the morning to avoid big sun in the afternoon.

Overrun by trees. This visit gave us plenty of photo opportunities. The trees taking over the building was amazing, it was easy to walk around and the guide gave us a lot of good, interesting information.

Unlock your inner Indiana Jones. It's the Wandering Yank here. Mrs. Yank and I recently spent 3 amazing days touring the Angkor complex, and this was one of the highlights. You've seen photos of the trees growing over the walls and sculptures, but they don't do it justice. Seeing it in person was unforgettable. There's not just one or two covered walls, but many. It's a very mysterious feel. Very cool!2 enthusiastic thumbs up!

Trees supporting the temple ruins....or is it the other way around?. Ta Prohm was our first temple visit in the Siem Riep area and what an introduction it was!It is a little trek from the entrance to get to the main portion of Ta Prohm which made what we saw all the more intriguing. When i saw the intertwining of tree and building for the first time i thought not only was it interesting but that this was the only one i would see so many photos were taken. Of course, unbeknownst to me there would be many more opportunities to appreciate the almost symbiotic relationship of plant and crafted stone. They say if the trees are removed much of the building would collapse and one can see how that could happen. Only later did we find out that there is a "hidden buddha", actually a tree that has grown in front of a buddha. We do not know where in Ta Prohm it is located. There are so many temples one can see in Siem Riep and people should definitely make an effort to include Ta Prohm. And what a cool souvenir your photo pass is as admission to the temples.

Still waiting for Lara Croft to appear. A no brainer on your Angkor complex tour. Go there at the end of the day, preferably close to closing time and you'll have the temple nearly for yourself and beautiful lighting
Amazing Place. Great temple slowly being restored , tree growth over temple just has to be seen to be believed.During April it was extremely hot and better to go early in the day as possible

Very romantic. Another great temple that is a must on the list. Film Tomb Rider made it so popular that you should go there early to avoid a huge crowd otherwise it gets busy and not so much fun to view it especially in 45 degrees heat.

This Is Real. When you look at the photos of Ta Prohm you find it hard to believe that it is real . . . it is. Looks like it's right out of "Raiders of the Lost Arc" (someone told us that indeed some of those films were made here). You have to see this to believe it. We were lucky as we were the only tourists to be there . . . It is one of the smaller ruins so may not get as much traffic (a blessing) and it is so worth spending time there.

Commonly known as Tomb Raider!. The locals introduced the temple as Tomb Raider! Cuz this was supposedly the site which they shoot the famous movie. The temple does look like the scene we saw in movie..so real! The roots are "eating" into every structure they can grab..the veins so thick that it smashes thru stone walls. This is only temple in Angkor region that we witness many thick iron rods as structure reinforcement. Other temples mostly uses wooden planks. The local guide said, this temple used to be for little girls learning dance moves. Sounds Sanctuary. take note; there are 2 different entrance/exit (or tuk tuk drop-off points). So make sure you check the site very carefully..which is difficult cuz ruins look similar. If you end up wrong exit point, easily another 15mins to cut across the temple. This is a popular temple but smaller than Angkor Wat (main temple), so lesser drinks/snacks stall.

favorite temple!. how cool is it that this is the lara croft tomb raider temple? the trees overgrowing the temple give it a little something more in my opinion, i really enjoyed this temple but try and get there early.. there are a lot of tourists.

Impressive. Impressive as nature "invaded" the whole building. Trees are born in the strangest places you can imagine and their roots are spreading over all.It really is like being in a movie, the Tomb Raider movie.

C'mon. C'mon. This Place is Spectacular.. It's everything you've read about and more. Simply stunning. The only thing I could possibly wish for would be to have a run of the place all to myself. I'm greedy that way. But it wasn't over-the-top crowded, so.... all is good.

Marvelous. Its breathtaking and the view is marvelous, this is my favourite, love the serenity and it felt so peaceful with the trees surrounding the temple. Love the ancient trees and architecture, most importantly the history behind the temples. Tour Guides in Siem Reap are all well trained to provide tourists a good overview of the Cambodian history
Ta Prohm. Amazing with huge and old tree. It is one part of the amazing visited place in angkor wat. Almost all the inside temple is mix with the tree.

Trees reclaim temple. It was fascinating to see how the trees and gravity had taken over the abandoned temple. It sort of gave you an idea of how our buildings will look if humans are no longer on the planet. There were still some interesting carvings and statues to see and our local tour guide was able to fill us in the history of the place. Beware the vendors on the way out - they will try and get top dollar out of you because they see you as a rich tourist.
Tree temple! . This temple is one of the coolest. The carvings are a little obscured due to all the destruction and weathering, but the sheer interface with the big trees around make it a must see.

Another amazing experience.. Our group visited Ta Prohm in the late afternoon and we just about had the place to ourselves, how lucky were we. This is the area that they filmed some of the Tomb Raider movie and you can certainly see why. It is a popular attraction of Angkor because much of the jungle has not been cleared which just adds to the fantastic scenery. If you thinking not doing this area think again I promise you, you won't be disappointed, its amazing and nobody knows how long it will remain.
Do not miss out! . To us the best and most beautifull temple! Not so crowded and very special since it is partially covered still with jungle vegetation. You can spend a full day there!

Spirituality in nature. Do not miss out on this temple - the trees growing out and over the temples is really a sight to be seen. Smaller than angkor wat and bayon, you do not need more than an hour for this one. Can get pretty crowded thanks to Tomb Raider, so be prepared.
Jungle takes back. You can see how this place was taken back by the jungle and left unfound for so long. Glad we saw it before it disappears and crumbles completely.
Not too be missed. These temples are really fantastic and a must see. It's really like stepping back in time. The way the trees have taken over is eerie.
Loved it like the other temples. What not to love about these wonders? Highly recommend doing visting you wont be disappointed!!! Just take it all in and enjoy

As Close to Tomb Raiding as You're Going to Get. Beautiful, enigmatic, and a genuine delight. We visited the sight as part of the smaller temple tour circuit, but the other, more grand, temples did not overshadow the overgrown Ta Prohm temple. Go to it, see it with your own eyes, it's a genuine marvel.
must see. if you are going to cambodia you must go to Ta Prohm, it was 40C when we went but it doesnt effect your enjoyment.

The Jungle Temple - a must see when in Angkor. While Angkor Wat gets all of the headlines, Ta Prohm is certainly a must see temple as well. This jungle temple with all of its uniqueness is something that cannot be missed if you're in Siem Reap. This is the temple seen in the Tomb Raider movie and it's truly incredible to see how the trees have grown around, through and on top of the temple walls. It's spectacular! Make sure you include Ta Prohm on your itinerary - you won't be disappointed!
Great one!!. The tree is in gold colour !! Can't believe it until I see with my own eye !! This is really miracle !! Love the history love the tree grow on the temple !! Must see
Worth Visiting. This is also in Angkor Area and really worth visiting once in a life time experience. Old construcion
Holiday. It's very amazing to see the huge trees with huge roots in the vicinity of Ta Prohm...that's the wonders if nature.

Likely the most photographed structures in all Siem Reap. It is like visiting a secret ghost town, and frankly - it is nothing to do with Tomb Raider. Spent an hour or so walking round and taking photos without the crowds. No words can describe the feeling you will get when you see this temple complex.

Breath taking. This was one of the busiest temples we stopped at, lots of tourists with their selfie sticks and super noisey, how ever we were able to find a beautiful little spot near the back of the temple and just sat there for 15 to really take it all in. If u can get away from the tourist groups this really was an amazing place!
Amazing. The way the trees and roots have grown through and around this crumbly temple is out of this world. Used as a location in Tomb Raider, absolute must see!

Tomb raider!. This is the place where you want to have a part in history where tomb raider was filmed! Trees coming out of the ruins is just unreal, growing on tops of buildings and rubble. Just remember to have a full battery on your camera!

A must go. Angkor Wat is huge and feels like a palace and Ta Phrom was like a home IMO. It felt almost mystical and to see the trees literally holding the structures today was , for a lack of a better word, amazed balls!! Besides the temples, do look at the trees! My favorite temple in Siem Reap.

A whole other world. I visited Ta Prohm and loved it. The strangler fig trees growing over the ruins are unreal. The entire Angkor comlex is out of this world amazing! I was just in awe of the beauty of everything. I highly recommend visiting. Get a three day pass in order to have the chance to visit all of the Angkor temples.

Just unbelievable!!!. Must be seen at the end of the day for the perfect light!
The gigantic trees growing over the ruins make you feel like Indiana Jones!
Loved the growth over the temple. A must see wh n here! Loved seeing the spots that many movies where shot! Beautiful carvings, don't miss this one!
Top 10 Site.. Very interesting site with a lot of quirky corners to see. Get there early after lunch before the coach loads of Chinese arrive. Movies were made here so get a photo in the right spot.

Ta Prohm was really cool. Visited Ta Prohm after Angkor. Very cool set of ruins here at Ta Prohm! I didn't know this was a Hindu temple. Looks like the Indian and Thai governments are working together to do some restoration. I toured on my own without a guide and had a grande time. The camera on my phone probably didn't capture the grandeur of this place and the trees growing over it. Make sure you have good walk in shoes on as it is pretty soft sand around the temple and uneven surfaces within the grounds.

Amazing how all the trees are now part of the temple. A wonderful experience not spoiled by the crowds of self-absorbed selfie stick owners. In my opinion Ta Prohm was the most impresive themple of all the temples I visited. One of the most interesting site. A must see!
Amazing Ta Phohm. Our tour started in this amazing place, it was so huge and there are lots of panoramic scenes you can capture. It was really a fun and educational experience for me and my kids.

Worth it!. Such beautiful temple ruins...well worth the visit. See the famous "Temple of Doom" movie shot with the beautiful tree growing out of the temple walls. Quiet and stunning. You'll enjoy walking around.

Like entering a lost world. Like a trip back in time to a lost world. Engulfed in Strangler Figs...the ancient stones of this magical and mysterious temple appear a bit as they did when French explorers discovered it. This former buddhist monastery draws you in and you feel as if you are the one discovering it for the first time. Tomb Raider was filmed here. Hate to say it but it is so amazing and mysterious you feel like it's a movie set! Highly recommended!

2nd visit. When we were here last time it was October....heaps and heaps of tourists. This time (April) it wasnt as busy...better photo opportunities....but so much hotter even though you have the trees helping to protect you from the sun.Just amazing to see the trees overtaking the temple. Make sure you take your time to really take it all in. Sometimes it can be so overwhelming and hot that you can rush thru some of the temples. If you really like one ,spend the time and enjoy

My favourite. Yes, I know it was in the movies but this place is incredibly photographic. Next time, I would go here for sunrise to beat the crowds that arrive after being at Angkor Wat. One thing that really annoyed me is the way some tourists were dressed. Yes it was hot but be respectful and cover up

Amazing Place. Ta Prohm has been the location of some memorable movies so it was great to visit the actual place. I believe the place must have been buried under the sand and the trees grew on the top soil. Many centuries later, someone discovered and the the soil was dug up and removed. But in any case, the place is just fascinating and incredible.

Ta Prohm. Ta Prohm is a fascinating temple. It is such a unique place. To see the thick roots growing through the structure of the ruins of the temple is an amazing sight. Nature is simply incredible and and is such a beautiful sight.

Nature meets ancient man-made temples. This temples is one of the many highlights in the Angkor Wat area. From a temple perspective definitely nice, but it was our last temple of the day so that didn't get out the thrills anymore, What made visiting these temples really a new experience was huge roots of enormous trees overtaking a lot of the made made structure of this temple complex. A fascinating sight. Two minus points do not lower the overall score, but should be mentioned. Too much fuzz over Mrs. Jolie and crap logistics. Walked around the complex twice before we found the proper way out.
My favourite. I loved this temple. It was cooler and more shaded. The lovely old fig trees taking over the ruins are amazing.

Staggeringly beautiful trip, despite the heat. Ta Prohm was, like for many others, the highlight of our Angkor tour. For one, you are finally out of the sun and in the shade a little bit, which after a long day of wandering about in the 104 (40C) degree heat, was much appreciated. This temple was considerably more crowded than other areas, as it is arguably the most well known. Everyone there refers to it as the Tomb Raider temple. Despite the movie being over 15 years old, Angelina Jolie still has quite a following in Siem Reap. The ruins are simply amazing, and no pictures do it justice. It's quite amazing to be there, right in it, in an area where you've seen a million pictures from. It was definitely one of the highlights of our two week trips, and many friends are jealous of our photos. We spent about an hour there, and saw all that you possibly could. Its an absolute must if you are doing Angkor.
Amazing. This could be lost to the world at anytime, Amazing it has stood the test of time and that it is intertwined with nature. Its more than just having been in a Tomb Raider movie

Ta Prohm. one of the most mysterious of all the temples of Angkor, Ta Prohm is visited as part of the Angkor circuit.despite some restoration work having been done, effort has been made to presrve in its original form with the result that most the temple is smothered by the roots of the giant banyan trees in temple complex lending it the mysterious character. Ta prohm became famous as a place after Angelina Jolie's Tomb Raider was shot here.
Do not miss it!. Clear #2 after Angkor Wat. Jungles around, trees growing through ruins, authentic atmosphere - all these make Ta Prohm beautiful and unique!
Big Rooted Trees Taking Over!. Ta Prohm is unbelievable! The giant trees with big roots are out of this world! Fascinating to see the forest taking over the buildings!

Interesting Wreck. Ta Prohm Temple is the one that you see pictures of with the massive roots growing through the walls and structures. It is one of the Temples that doesn't have much reconstruction going on so it is a wreck of building stones and broken walls. The roots are fun to see live. Was the middle of the day, very hot and low density of tourists. Many exquisite carvings and reliefs. Long hallways and side courtyards.

Amazing. We had a fantastic taxi driver (who picked us up from the airport when we first arrived)He took us on a day trip to the main attractions and Ta Prohm was one of those locations.Again words are hard to describe a place as amazing as this.Although you may have seen Ta Prohm on Tomb Raider it is like being on a film set as a place like this just doesn't seem possible to exist other than on a film set I loved it here again a fantastic place to visit

Really cool . The temple is great, like so many of the other temples. What makes this temple stand out are the enormous trees that have and are consuming portions of the temple. It's no fault of the temple but being so immensely popular it is difficult to see everything and capture good pictures. Avoid this temple when there are large tourist groups from Korea or China.

My Favourite. Out of all the temples this has to be my favourite. This is definately one of the most interesting ones with the trees covering the temples and there are many hidden gems inside. It is so much more than a film and I could have easily spent the day here. you cannot miss this!

Ta Prohm. This was one of my favorite temples in Siem Reap. It's extremely hot in April arrive when they open at 7:30am when it's slightly cooler and to avoid all the tour buses. It's truly a magical place that can really be enjoyed when their isn't huge crowds. Also ask your driver to drop you off at the entrance that is closer to the temple so you start there and then move on to the smaller temples.
Mother nature vs mankind. Worth your time to see the amazing nature vs mankind. Not because of the movie. Too many people to get a great picture but must see.

The famous "Tomb Raider's" temple. Ta Prohm is one of the most over grown structures in the Angkor complex, with over a dozen massive trees which have taken root (literally) on top of the ancient buildings! It's pretty impressive and you can easily tell why it was used for the filming of a magical ancient tomb!

Tomd Raider Temple. Made famous with the Tomb Raider movie with Angelina Jolie. Is a lot more dilapidated than the other temples due to the damage that the trees have caused, but still a must to visit.
Another fabulous and historical site. They all have something different, they way this emerges from the back drop is stunning. plan to be there at lunch time.

Favorite temple of them all!. It's like being in a secret garden at Ta Prohm. I'm so glad we got to see it this year because I read that they're going to start cutting the trees down to keep them from damaging the temple.

Don't Get Lost!. This is such a neat place! The forest is trying it's best to reclaim this temple and it makes for a spooky visit. The colors from the plants interacting with the stone are beautiful. Follow the trails or go with a guide as the complex is large and getting lost in it wouldn't be too hard to do.

Had to be done. We did the bigger temples, I asked our guide to pop into this one as we were on half day tour. It was my favourite by far, forgetting the Tomb raider link.
I believe it gets heaving in high season but I loved it

The Tomb Raider temple. One of teh most famous. We got a lot more out of it by being friendly to one of the many guards and he took us on his own tour of the temple. That includes a lot of background on features of teh temple without having to read the book, taking pictures in all the right spots and angles, plus a few spots that were not accessible to the public.
So nice. I love this temple coz they make the movie tomb raider there and i like this movie so much mostly amgelina jolie who try to help my country

Good attraction. This temple was one of the more interesting ones we visited (and we did A LOT) however it will be very busy and you will be queuing to take photos at the good spots etc. Worth a visit though

Special place. Enjoyed this place more than the bigger Angkor Wat and Angkor Thom. The massive trees and roots really give the ruins an amazing atmosphere. Remember these places were lost for hundreds of years until circa 1860, and with this one you can feel the sense of time as it really is part of the jungle. We went in early April and were delighted by how few people there were. April is the start of the off season so I would suggest April, May travel to fully enjoy this without the crowds. Beautiful place!

Really incredibl. The way that nature is taking over the place, make this temple something really special.Of course main attraction for the majority is to see the trees were the Tomb Rider movie was film, But the place is much more than that.

Tomb raiders. A eerie place with trees growing out of walls, on top of temples and the location for filming Tomb Raiders. Very interesting and the archeologists still have years of work here to get the stones back in order to recreate many more walls and temples.
Indochina trip. Ta Prohm was may be my most favorite place at Angkor, may be because it felt so wild, nature has really taken over.

A Favorite. It is hard to pick my favorite temple in Angkor Wat, but this might have been the one. I went out alone as my friend was icing her knee. There were only a few visitors and I was free to wander and take as many photos as I wanted. I couldn't make the tuk tuk driver take me to the eastern gate to enter, he had his process and didn't care about mine. Stunning and amazing place, you'll never regret making the effort to see.

Great Contrast between Nature & Man. This was my favorite temple other then Angkor Wat. It was easy to walk into and then to climb in and all over the temple was a real treat. Trees and roots grow in and out of the temple over the last 200 years, though this temple was built around 1300.

The trees are winning!. Despite the many other visitors, you still take away impressive images of the temple. Nature has intertwined roots and branches throughout the complex, overturned stone blocks and sprung trees from rooftops. Even though walking on the pathways is a little restrictive, it's to protect the site. It was uncomfortable watching people who had climbed over the handrails to pose for photos.
A place to remember. another must see its a reasonable walk to get to but well worth it, good walking shoes water and a hat. we went in March and was quite warm .. highly recommend

What did you Say?. I said if you didn't go to Ta Prohm, then you did not go to Angkor. My wife and I had a impromptu personal tour by a friendly police man at this site. He was genuinely interested in us getting some great photo angles and I think he was attracted to us simply he overheard my wife giving advice to some other tourists on a particular photo angle - you see its such large Banyan tree .. its just difficult to get it all in the frame - plus also there are several trees etc .. get your self to Ta Prohm

The place movies are made!. Ta Prohm was very cool, just the trees and their roots were enough for me to be happy but the temple was way cool too! Movies have been filmed at this temple. This temple is different from all of the other temples in the Angkor Wak complex.

the trees!. this temple is incredible in the fact that the trees have really taken over it. the arches and doorways and passages are all entwined with thick roots that make a person feel really young! some roots are so thick that they have artificial supports holding them up. its an incredible place to visit.

One of the best places I have visited. Angkor Wat is a well known temple but in certain aspects, this is more visually stunning than its more famous neighbour...if i could say so...an absolute pleasure...

Incredible. Ta Prohm was an amazing temple to visit in Siem Reap. You need to pay an admission before going to temples. Ask your tuk tuk to take you there first. It was $30.00 US for a day pass. You must show this pass to get into any of the temples. Wear sleeved shirts to show respect. Mostly outdoors protect yourself from the heat we used umbrellas as it was very hot.

Beautiful but not what I expected. This temple is beautiful but not what I expected. It doesn't have an authentic feel since now there are ropes, wooden paths and platforms as well as a giant crane and scaffolding. It was difficult to take good photos with the amount of man made junk in the frame. The amount of tourists and the ropes and path take away the magic. But it is still beautiful.
Tomb raider. Fascinating temple with the jungle growing through it. One of the Lara Croft films was set here. A bit more conservation could be done
Tomb Rider for one hour!. A really stunning experience. Looks even better "live" than on pictures and you can really feel the magic of beeing a "Tomb Rider"

Touristy, but still amazing. This was much more "American" in that there were more areas roped off and a lot more warning signs than Angkor. Also, the Tomb Raider area was obviously the place to get a picture. Having visited during the hot season of April, there weren't many tourists. At times it really felt like you were the first person to be visiting these ancient ruins.

Where nature meets archaelogy. The infamous Tomb Raider temple. It was hard getting a photo at the "movie tree" so either go really early or really late. By far one of my favourites, even trumps Angkor Wat. With the trees sprouting through the temple, it has a very authentic nature vs man feel. We went without a guide and wandered aimlessly - it was perfect!

Do not miss it.. This is known for being the location for Angelina Jolie in the movie Tomb Raider. Forget that. It is fantastic to wander through the many passageways here and marvel at the superb stone carvings and discover hidden areas.
How how how ?..... How do these enormous trees grow over the temples, how does the stone temples stay standing, how were they built, so many questions but no answers!
movie set. This temples group is magical, tyhis trees growing in the temples is just incredible. No wonder they used it as film set for the movie "Tombraider"

Can't Mess with Mother Nature!. These roots were amazing to see. This wasn't my fav site, but the sheer force of mother nature against these stone buildings was pretty incredible. It opens at 7:30, so keep this in mind if you're an early riser like me :)
A must see temple.. This is one temple that you should not miss, when you've seen it in the movies, it is awesome the actually be there.

A very atmospheric site. Ta Prohm is an amazing site. It was abandoned for centuries, during which the jungle grew over it. Archaeologists have removed most of the trees but there are still some growing over the ruins of the ancient temple giving it a very special appeal.

My favourite temple in this beautiful archaeological park. My favourite temple in this beautiful archaeological park. A definite must see! It's not as touristy as Angkor Wat, though provides you with much more intimate experience and more direct connection with the remaining of this medieval Khmer temple. Love it! Go there to relax your mind and contemplate the centuries of difficult and stormy Cambodian history. Obviously, dine out in one of the nearby open air Cambodian restaurants. A traditional Khmer dish in the evening is a must.
Amazing!. We enjoyed our trip here but didn't have a guide and got lost! This actually added to the feeling of the place though as it is all a bit surreal!

Lots of nature. My husband and I really enjoyed Ta Prohm more so then the other temples. It is further away then Angkor Wat and more in the woods. Lots of large trees throughout the temple and it gives you that nature feel as you walk through. Great experience.

Indiana Jones and the Crystal Skull. If you are a film buff this will fulfill your fantasies but there is so much more. Artist, Historian, Explorer, this place has it all. The way the trees have enveloped the buildings is totally amazing and I am so pleased they had the foresight not to clear them totally. Unique.

This is Mothers House. A much more tranquil vibe at this temple. It can get crowded at times but nothing near what the major temples are like. As with anywhere in Siem Reap just be mindful of the large tour groups from China and Korea, stand aside and let them pass lest you get trampled.

spectacular. we visited Ankor , Bayon and Banteay Srei but without doubt this was my favorite, awesome, magical, enchanting , facinating, we got here really early with our tour guide Bun, before anyone arrived so we had the peace and quiet for about 45 mins before we saw anyone else, its just .......incredible.
where nature and human constructions meet. The trees have grown all over the temple building and it makes for innovative photos and a reminder that nature will always win.

Terrific Ta. This is the Tomb Raider temple and so attracts huge crowds like Angkor Wat. Luckily we went at the end of the season so we're able to walk around freely. But our guide warned us that there are horrendous queues during the high season. This temple is quite broken down and overgrown with trees bursting through the walls. Quite a sight.

The Tombraider temple!. Although it can get mobbed by swarms of tour groups at a time, it is still so full of character with the jungle reclaiming the ancient stone that it's a must-see! Definitely a highlight of all the temples visoted! Bring a fan! It gets hot out there in the sun!

A Place To Go.. Very surprised, Smilestour guides took me to. It is a place that I had caught it in the movie, amazing.
With the temple is located in a wooded area, was built thousands of years ago, but everything seems intact.
Feeling is hard to describe, it was ancient, with ancient trees with roots buried in the shrine hug.

Everything mystical and magical.. We've probably all seen those images of this temple in the Raiders movie and elsewhere. The huge trees with their expansive root systems gradually taking over this ancient temple are mind blowing.The temple exhorts a quaintness in its architectural style, but it is beautifully designed and constructed. It is in poor condition in places, but a continual restoration program keeps it in such condition that we can safely explore and let our minds go back to a very grand past.
Temple tour. This is my favourite temple. Built by the king for his mother. It is so beautiful and ornate. Nature has taken over in some parts but that only adds to its uniqueness and beauty

Amazing trees!!!. Must visit this place as the trees are absolutely amazing. The colours and the sheer size of them are mind blowing. It can at times get a bit crowded but overall a great experience. It's amazing to see how the root comes through the walls and how the trees are formed. There's also a spot where Lara craft shot one of the tomb raider scene I believe.
Most 'untouched'. Still some jungle feeling, but a lot of repair works going on to keep it from falling apart. Different from the other temples in the area.

Worth a visit. We visited this ancient site after visiting Angkor Thom. It is fascinating to see the remains of the ancient buildings among the forest. There are magnificent trees intermingled with the remains of the buildings. Our guide was very knowledgeable and led us through this site whilst telling us more of the history surrounding it. This was popular but not quite as busy as some of the other sites in this area. It was a very hot time of the year to visit.

Organised walk. There are signs and arrows that direct you around Ta Prohm. It helps to avoid getting lost. Try to walk around the outside of the ruins to get another perspective. It is stunning to see the architecture built so long ago. The kids loved it as well. Go early to avoid the bus traffic.
laura croft film.. a very nice place. didn't have to go early.very hot place,water needed. where solid footwear. take a camera.

Beautiful Place. This is a must see when in Siem Reap. Great place filled with history. Make sure to get a guide which you can book for a whole day to see multiple temples to get familiar with the history of this region.

Visit Angkor Wat first. Visit Angkor Wat first, and then the other temples if you have time. Visiting the entire site of temples takes you more than a day, even though you can visit all the temples in a day's time. Be prepared to walk alot.

Otherworldly and truly exotic. Make sure you visit this temple. Apart from being famous, it is stunning and truly belongs to the earth and the planet. Sounds like a hippy statement but go there and feel the energy and history dripping from every stone.
Amazing temple!. Breathtaking, amazing place, it feels like travel in time :) Strongly recommended. Daily ticket to see temples cost $20
Really worth it!. So many temples to see and experience, soooooo hot! This one is so interesting. You can truly see how the jungle is trying to reclaim the environment
Intriguing and Fasinating. The way the trees have grown around the temples, really are an amazing sight to see. You won't need long at this place but be sure to take photos at the right places.

Nice trees. Worth a visit and included in your temple ticket at 40 USD for 3 days
A lot quieter than Angkor Wat which is a bonus
Nice trees .... can do this one in 45 minutes max
Excellence. This is by far my favourite temple to visit in Siem Reap Cambodia. If you have a chance to visit the temples of Angkor, don't forget this one.

Natural Beauty. Lots of great photo opportunities. You need to experience it yourself, its really unique, especially with the big tree growing on the temple. Please donate to the musicians on the road to the temple, they have retrained following loss of limbs due to the landmines.
Tomb Raider Site. This is really unique compared to the massive Angkor Wat. Area is well preserved. There are a lot of beautiful big trees that add to the mystique of this area.

Tomb Raider. Beautiful, but crowded since all visitors must follow the same path through the temple.Book a guide and they help navigate you through as well as explaining a lot about the ruins and local trees.The shops and stalls located just outaide offer a better price than in the city. Remember to bargain.We spent 1-2 hours here, but were pretty keen to leave due to the crowds. We arrived in the morning around 9am
Lara Croft - where are you?. Worth going to see where the movie was made. Still waiting for Lara to appear. Lots of history - make sure you have a guide.
A must!. Our kids loved this enchanted place - like nothing else in the world! Fully of the majesty of nature reclaiming land in an exotic way
Amazing !. Those trees and temples are blended with each other. It's really amazing to see the ancient temples standing here.

This was one of my favorite temples. Avoid the crowds and start with this one. Very gorgeous as you can see how amazing nature is, the trees have a life of their own and make everything look more mysterious.

Favorite temple in Siem Reap. All of the ruins in Siem Reap are beautiful, but Ta Prohm stood out to me as the most mysterious and unique of them all. The trees growing throughout the ruins are awe-inspiring. It's also very easy walking compared to some of the other strenuous ruins. If you go early close to opening, you might avoid some of the loud and pushy tour groups.
WoW. Definitely my favourite out of the 3 main temples that we visited. A must see site to visit. The trees are unbelievable
The trees are the attraction.. Tumb a raiders spot. Trees are actually holding up the temple. A small temple but very interesting. A tourist destination.

A highlight at Angkor. Ta Prohm is beautifully spun in the web of trees within Angkor's boundaries. This temple, as the others, are unlike most "ruins" around the world. Ta Prohm was not overly populated, with the exception of the webbed doorway. I do recommend going to the webbed doorway. It is otherwise undisturbed and you can go off the trail somewhat. If you are visiting Angkor, it's a must. Ta is within walking distance of some, but certainly within Tuktuk of all.

Unbelievably wonderful. No need for many words here. This place is nothing compare with what you saw on the movie years ago. It is full of history, amazing carved stones. Even with all the people around, it is fascinating to imaging how this place was many centuries ago. While visiting these Angkor complex temples, make sure to bring drinking water, specially when visiting during the dry season. Heat can be little extreme but nothing that can't be fixed with cold water. We took our two boys (11 and 7) and they had a great time.

Absolutely Amazing. This was one of the best experiences of all the temples. The symbiosis of man made structures and the forces of nature are at work in this beautiful natural work of art. very special place.
Calm. Nowhere near as busy as the other temples in the complex. Truly spectacular images of the temple taken over hy the jungle. Don't know how it's still standing!

Iconic temple . Loved exploring this amazing temple despite the torrential downpour that started as we arrived. The crowds cleared out, leaving a handful of intrepid explorers to roam these beautiful ruins undisturbed.

Sureal. this is an amazing place to visit. Not far from Angkor Wat. Gives you a good idea of what it was like when they found these temples and cities. Hidden in the jungle and taken over by nature. A wonderful, magical place.

Incredible. Take prohm was an amazing temple to visit in siem reap. You need to pay an admission before going to temples ask your tuk tuk to take you there first. It was $30 US for a day pass. You must show this pass to get into any of the temples. Wear sleeved shirts to show respect. Mostly outdoors protect yourself from the heat we used umbrellas as it was very hot.
Tomb Raider fans be prepared. Site is very interesting, rescued from the jungle but not over restored. Trees grow in,out and over the ruins. Less strenuous than other sites in the Angkor region.

Fantastic place. Somehow the trees growing into the decaying broken down temples give beauty and life to what was a lost civilisation. Not too much to climb, easily accessible. Great sights and photos.
Beauty. This is a wonderful place, and it feels great--maybe because it is relatively undisturbed...being held up by trees and steel beams...so exquisite...

Another beautiful temple. Ta Phrom is colloquially known by many as the "tomb raider temple" as a Tomb Raider movie was shot here. I prefered this temple to Angkor Wat itself, and in my opinion the tree roots amongst the temple give it a unique beauty.
Interesting. Nice place to walkaround and admire the ruins and the trees. Too many tourists, too much noise, too many beggars, though.
The most beautiful of all the temples. Simply stunning - photos do not really do justice to the dramatic way the trees have overtaken the buildings. A must see.
Tomb Raider. The movie brought this site to my attention. But aside from that information, the site is awesome. A photographer's delight with tree root patterns everywhere.
Very worthwhile!. This iconic temple is even more impressive in person! How the structures still stand with trees taking over is beyond comprehension.

Don't miss this. Truly an amazing place to go to. I was astonished by the gigantic trees that are hundreds of years old. There were long queues at these places since everyone wants to have a memorable shoots taken there.

Tree Temple. I thought that this was the most fascinating of all the temples in the Siem Reap area, primarily because of the Fig trees that are growing on it. I visited this temple while on a birding trip to Cambodia and really enjoyed the atmosphere of a temple in a forest. Besides the artwork and structure of the temple the trees were a magnet for several species of parrot and other birds. Definitely make a stop at this temple if visiting the area; the only drawback being the hoards of venders in the parking areas, but once you get to the temple they are gone.
Very cool!. I loved this temple. The trees appear to be swallowing the temple and some of the buildings are in the process of being rebuilt. You should try to visit this one.
Nature is claiming it back. The way the trees are taking over the temple is amazing. It's a shame that it's so crowded, but once again, well worth the visit.
Amazing . This temple is amazing because the trees are growing on the temples roofs and the temples are not fall down. The temple is vey huge and good to learn architecture.

Very unique. The temple is very much falling apart, but it is still wonderful. The trees and temples have become one, and its amazing to walk around the grounds and discover many passages. Its a bit like a maze this place with many one way paths with guards to enforce it too which can be rather frustrating. It is also very busy here, with queues at every photo area, so it would be better to get here early if you want to avoid the crowds, but its inevitable, you cant see all of these temples without coming across busy crowds.
The "Tomb Raider" Temple. A great honor to be at the Tomb Raider movie site! Being there & witnessed the humongous trees "swallowing" the temple was really wowww....

Tomb Raider Wat. A surreal experience where the jungle is reclaiming it's habitat. There is a nice orderly flow to experience the Wat...we entered from the East Gate. Beware locals who offer to take your photograph as they will then proceed to take you on a mini tour and then extort money from you for their "sick mother"....this is all done under the watchful eye of the official tourist police and clearly condoned. We escaped $11USD poorer. Because this left a bitter taste in our mouths we made for the nearest exit which was the West Entry ....this meant that we had to make our way back to the East Gate to meet our Driver. A very busy site during the New Year season.

absolutely amazing trees within temples. you need a full day to view and appreciate. I arrived a bit late and had little time to walk and view. make sure you arrive early morning to enjoy every bit of your walk and to appreciate the beauty of these trees built into temples.

Giant Roots holding the Tomb Raider Temple.... Ta Phrom is a must visit site in Angkor itinerary...I reached Ta Phrom at noon ..and it was hot n sunny...by just entering inside I felt I got lost myself in an ancient period of ruins and rumbles n boulders. The temple s so huge and the giant robots have crept all over the structure and gripping the stones..The huge roots and the trees were grown all over and tourists flock to take snaps of the roots..Ta Phrom has also a classical Khmer style of construction and the paths were well paved and mandapas were designed with utmost structural design and techniques..The exit side of the West entrance is a large Barry water reservoir. created by the Kings...Ta Phrom is an ultimatum of ruins structure reflecting us the past...

Most enjoyable temple in Angkor.. This was my favourite temple in the area. Far less crowded than Angkor Wat with far less rubbish. Also a bit cooler given good tree coverage. The trees also add to the atmosphere giving it a more mysterious feel. Yes it is run-down but it also feels a bit less sterile and more like it might have been when discovered.
Go see this!. Amazing....really amazing...definitely worth the trip! So photo worthy and wish I could stay the whole day!

Best place of all . Wow simply unbelievable and stunning. A place I would return to despite the heat. This is the place Tomb Raider was filmed with Angelina Jolie, and you can see the reason why they chose to film here. A world heritage site as all the temples are here in beautiful Seim Reap.

Don't Miss Ta Prohm!. Next to Angkor Wat, this was by far my favorite part of my tour in Siem Reap. The trees have grown over the ruins, and even though it was decently crowded it was still very enjoyable. It's included in the "small tour" and while some of the stuff in the middle got a little redundant, Ta Prohm got me very excited again.
Most picturesque temple.. Possibly the most picturesque temple in Angkor. The giant trees taking over the temple ruins make it look like a movie set, like it is not real. Wonderful, wonderful!

Beautiful place!. You gonna fall in love with this place from first looking))Awesome Connection of Nature and Great Ancient Temple!Still can't believe that I was there just few days ago and saw all this beauty by my own eyes! )))

For the Lara Croft in you. This place is certainly unique with the merging of tall trees' roots and the structures. A little bit crowded but worth the visit. It might look small but with a lot of small passageways, you might end up getting a bit confused with directions. Other than that, I enjoyed seeing this one!

Wake up early.... get here early. Get here before the morning tour groups hit. That means getting up good and early and getting here. This is one of the most remarkable places in the world. Enjoy some solitude by walking around the perimeter courtyards and walls. Don't just stay in the center of the temple area.

One of the easier temples to get around. This is one of the easier temples to explore and fascinating how the trees have taken it over and grown through the stone structures, it does not cover a great deal of area as some of the other temples do.You need to be there early before the crowds and tourist buses arrive to be able to get some nice pictures.
Incredible. This place is amazing. The enormous trees are taking over and destroying many places which is a shame. A lot of restoration work is being done.

Experience your inner tomb raider. Lovely small temple, you can see why it was used for tomb raider and all these years later it's still the well known for this. You really do need a guide to get the maximum experience out of these temples as there are little highlights you will miss otherwise

An absolute 'must see'!. Together with Angkor Wat, Ta Prohm was a 'must see' for us and this was probably one of our favourite temples. Everything that you imagine from guide books and more.We visited later in the afternoon so temperatures were particularly fierce here, with little shade, but the beauty far outweighed the heat. Plenty of incredible photo opportunities and memories to treasure!
Ta Prohm. The second busiest temple we visited. The tress growing out of the ruins is amazing. Long queues but our guide helped us miss the waiting.
Never tire of this place. Despite these days the place being full of tourists, it is still one of my favourite temples in Cambodia.

Large group guided visit.... . If you want to view a spectacular temple with a famous movie filmed in it... This is the one! We had a guided tour, the temple is spectacular, not on the scale of Angkor Wat, but beautiful nonetheless.
A must in Angkor . This temple made famous after the Lara Croft movie. Loses of big trees creeps into the building. Best to go in the morning when it's cooler

Fascinating and very impressive!. The huge trees, giant roots twining all over the ruins were so fascinating and it's a real wonder of the world which is not to be missed. The giant roots practically entwine the remaining structures including doorways which makes it so unique.
Stunningly beautiful. Very taken once again by amazing architecture and how these buildings have stood the test of time. Lots of history and great photo opportunities. Very beautiful

ok. Not certain what the fascination is with a temple whose claim to fame is that it was the setting for a film with a Hollywood superstar. I found it uninteresting except for a photo of an ancient wall covered by tree roots and a panel of dancers. There are more than 200 temples in the area to see and this is not one I would return to visit.

The Lara Croft Temple!. As its more popularly known! It's pretty surreal with the trees growing over it. Lots of roots everywhere! These are massive trees that have grown over these temples, engulfing them slowly... makes one think how long these ruins have stood here and how old these temples are!

The Forces of Nature. Popularized by the Tomb Raider Movie, Bayon Temple is a perfect example of the power of nature. Years of neglect has cause the big roots of the trees to overpower the man made temple. Giant roots twist and twine all over the remaining structures lifting and displacing the stones built as if they weighed nothing. During the rainy season, the temple floods a bit but everything is beautiful and green - alive with moss covered walls.

Ideal for Tomb Raider fans!. The trees have been allowed to take over this temple in the past, which gives it a unique feel, however, the trees are now being controlled to ensure no more damage occurs to the stone work. We were not that impressed with it, although some people were fascinated with the place!
